tower building little rock arsenal

unk mary barker
unk mary barker 28 june 1895 16 february 1973 english illustrator best known series fantasy illustrations depicting fairies flowers barker art education began girlhood correspondence courses instruction croydon school art earliest professional work included unk cards juvenile magazine illustrations first book flower fairies spring published 1923 similar books published following decades
barker devout anglican donated artworks christian fundraisers missionary organizations produced christian themed books children book hymns collaboration sister dorothy leadeth designed stained glass window st edmund church pitlake painting christ child darling world come purchased queen mary
barker equally proficient unk pen ink oils unk kate greenaway pre unk principal influences work claimed paint instinctively rejected artistic theories barker died 1973 though published flower fairy books spring summer autumn themes 1985 winter collection assembled remaining work published posthumously

gambia women national football team

team

background development
development women football africa faces several challenges including limited access education poverty amongst women unk human rights abuses targeting women funding another issue impacting game africa financial assistance comes fifa national football associations another challenge retention football players many women footballers leave continent seek greater opportunity europe united states

description
pectoral fin disc plain maskray thin diamond shaped narrowly rounded outer corners measuring 1 1 1 3 times longer wide leading margins disc gently unk converge broad angle pointed tip snout small eyes placed close together behind spiracles nostrils elongated skirt shaped flap skin small mouth bears prominent unk corners contains two slender papillae floor small papillae also found around outside mouth five pairs gill slits pelvic fins fairly large pointed
tail short barely exceeding length disc intact broad flattened base leading usually two unk spines stings tail becomes slender bears long ventral fin fold much shorter lower dorsal fin fold body lacks dermal denticles midline row 4 13 small closely spaced thorns present behind spiracles another row 0 4 thorns stings dorsal coloration grayish green becoming pinkish towards disc margins dark mask like shape around eyes pair small dark blotches behind spiracles tail behind stings alternating black white bands variable width ending black tip underside plain white ventral fin fold light grayish color species grows 24 cm 9 4 across 45 cm 18 long
distribution habitat

john cullen
barry john cullen born august 2 1964 canadian former professional ice hockey centre played national hockey league nhl pittsburgh penguins hartford whalers toronto maple leafs tampa bay lightning standout player boston university school time leading scorer buffalo sabres selected 1986 nhl supplemental draft chose offer contract cullen signed flint spirits international hockey league ihl 1987 88 season named ihl co rookie year valuable player leading league scoring
career halted 1997 diagnosed non hodgkin lymphoma attempted brief comeback 1998 18 month battle disease nhl awarded bill masterton memorial trophy retiring serve assistant coach year lightning cullen played two nhl star games career joined brother car dealership business leaving game briefly operated dealership forced close automotive industry crisis 2008 10
early life
cullen born unk ontario august 2 1964 one six children barry unk cullen father unk brian ray played nhl cullen three brothers played well father never pressured preferring enjoy game
idolized elder brother terry considered top nhl prospect terry career ended suffered broken neck hit behind boards college game brother highly sought american universities john received two scholarship offers choosing play boston university bu 1983
time mother unk diagnosed skin cancer following death early freshman year cullen contemplated returning ontario home convinced father continue school hockey used game cope loss dedicated every game played mother memory cullen felt inspiration drew mother battle allowed become better player

geopyxis carbonaria
geopyxis carbonaria species fungus genus geopyxis family unk first described science 1805 given current name 1889 species commonly known charcoal loving elf cup dwarf unk cup unk unk cup pixie cup small unk shaped fruitbodies fungus reddish brown whitish fringe measure 2 cm 0 8 across short tapered stalk fruitbodies commonly found soil brush recently burned sometimes great numbers fungus distributed throughout many temperate regions northern hemisphere found europe turkey north america although primarily saprotrophic species feeding decomposing organic matter remaining fire also forms biotrophic associations roots norway spruce
taxonomy
fungus first described scientifically 1805 johannes unk von unk lewis david de unk peziza carbonaria unk unk cooke illustrated fruitbodies spores asci 1879 work unk unk unk unk figures fungi parts world 1889 pier andrea unk transferred fungus genus geopyxis giving species current name unk carbonaria published heinrich unk 1884 synonym g carbonaria louis joseph unk proposed variety geopyxis carbonaria var unk 1937 referring forms producing fruitbodies without stalk taxon considered independent taxonomic significance 1860 miles berkeley moses ashley curtis described species peziza unk collections made japan part north pacific exploring surveying expedition 1853 1856 taxon synonymized g carbonaria unk unk 1968 taxonomic opinion corroborated donald unk decade later

charles eaton raaf officer
charles eaton obe afc 21 december 1895 12 november 1979 senior officer unk royal australian air force raaf later served diplomat born london joined british army upon outbreak world war saw action western front transferring royal flying corps 1917 unk bomber pilot 206 squadron twice captured german forces twice escaped eaton left military 1920 worked india moving australia 1923 two years later joined raaf serving initially instructor 1 flying training school 1929 1931 chosen lead three expeditions search lost aircraft central australia gaining national attention earning air force cross zeal devotion duty
1939 eve world war ii eaton became inaugural commanding officer 12 general purpose squadron newly established raaf station darwin northern australia promoted group captain following year appointed officer order british empire 1942 took command 79 wing batchelor northern territory 1943 mentioned despatches operations south west pacific unk raaf december 1945 eaton took diplomatic posts dutch east indies heading united nations commission consul general indonesian national revolution returned australia 1950 served canberra two years unk known moth eaton farmer later life died 1979 age 83 commemorated several memorials northern territory
early life world war
charles eaton born 21 december 1895 lambeth london son william walpole eaton unk wife grace unk unk charles worked unk town council age fourteen joining london regiment upon outbreak world war august 1914 attached bicycle company 24th battalion 47th division arrived western front march 1915 took part trench bombing missions attacks enemy lines communication seeing action battles unk ridge unk unk somme

tina fey
elizabeth unk tina fey unk born may 18 1970 american actress comedian writer producer best known work nbc sketch comedy series saturday night live 1998 2006 impression former alaska governor 2008 vice presidential candidate sarah palin creating acclaimed series 30 rock 2006 2013 unbreakable kimmy schmidt 2015 present also well known appearing films mean girls 2004 baby mama 2008 date night 2010 unk wanted 2014 sisters 2015

elephanta caves
elephanta caves network sculpted caves located elephanta island gharapuri literally city caves mumbai harbour 10 kilometres 6 2 mi east city mumbai indian state maharashtra island located arm arabian sea consists two groups caves first large group five hindu caves second smaller group two buddhist caves hindu caves contain rock cut stone sculptures representing shaiva hindu sect dedicated lord shiva

michael jordan
michael jeffrey jordan born february 17 1963 also known initials mj american retired professional basketball player also businessman principal owner chairman charlotte hornets jordan played 15 seasons national basketball association nba chicago bulls washington wizards biography nba website states acclamation michael jordan greatest basketball player time jordan one effectively marketed athletes generation considered instrumental popularizing nba around world 1980s 1990s
jordan played three seasons coach dean smith university north carolina member tar unk national championship team 1982 jordan joined nba chicago bulls 1984 third overall draft pick quickly emerged league star entertaining crowds prolific scoring leaping ability demonstrated performing slam unk free throw line slam dunk contests earned nicknames air jordan unk also gained reputation one best defensive players basketball 1991 first nba championship bulls followed achievement titles 1992 1993 securing three peat although jordan abruptly retired basketball beginning 1993 94 nba season pursue career baseball returned bulls march 1995 led three additional championships 1996 1997 1998 well record 72 regular season wins 1995 96 nba season jordan retired second time january 1999 returned two nba seasons 2001 2003 member wizards

background
1795 poland ceased exist sovereign nation throughout 19th century remained partitioned degrees prussian austrian russian empires end world war independence restored nation reunited although drawing boundary lines necessity contentious issue independent poland lasted 21 years attacked divided among foreign powers
1 september 1939 germany invaded poland initiating world war ii europe 17 september pursuant unk unk pact poland invaded soviet union subsequently poland partitioned two powers remained occupation war 1 october germany soviet union completely overrun poland although polish government never formally surrendered polish underground state subordinate polish government exile soon formed 8 october nazi germany annexed western areas pre war poland remainder occupied area established general government soviet union temporarily give territorial gains made 1939 due german invasion soviet union permanently annexed much territory winning back mid 1944 course war poland lost 20 pre war population amid occupation marked end second polish republic

policy

sms markgraf
sms markgraf third battleship four ship könig class served imperial german navy world war battleship laid november 1911 launched 4 june 1913 formally commissioned imperial navy 1 october 1914 two months outbreak war europe markgraf armed ten 30 5 centimeter 12 0 guns five twin turrets could steam top speed 21 knots 39 km h 24 mph markgraf named honor royal family baden name markgraf rank german nobility equivalent english unk marquess
along three sister ships könig grosser kurfürst kronprinz markgraf took part fleet actions war including battle jutland 31 may 1 june 1916 jutland markgraf third ship german line heavily engaged opposing british grand fleet sustained five large caliber hits crew suffered 23 casualties markgraf also participated operation albion conquest gulf riga late 1917 ship damaged mine en route germany following successful conclusion operation

battle jutland
markgraf present fleet operation resulted battle jutland took place 31 may 1 june 1916 german fleet sought draw isolate portion grand fleet destroy main british fleet could retaliate markgraf third ship german line behind sisters könig grosser kurfürst followed kronprinz four ships made v division iii battle squadron vanguard fleet iii battle squadron first three battleship units directly unk kaiser class battleships vi division iii battle squadron iii squadron followed unk nassau classes ii battle squadron rear guard obsolescent unk class pre dreadnoughts battle squadron
shortly 16 00 battlecruisers scouting group encountered british 1st battlecruiser squadron command vice admiral david beatty opposing ships began artillery duel saw destruction unk shortly 17 00 queen mary less half hour later time german battlecruisers steaming south draw british ships toward main body high seas fleet 17 30 könig crew spotted scouting group 1st battlecruiser squadron approaching german battlecruisers steaming starboard british ships steamed port 17 45 scheer ordered two point turn port bring ships closer british battlecruisers minute later order open fire given
markgraf opened fire battlecruiser tiger range 21 000 yards 19 000 markgraf two sisters fired secondary guns british destroyers attempting make torpedo attacks german fleet markgraf continued engage tiger 18 25 time faster battlecruisers managed move effective gunnery range period battleships warspite valiant 5th battle squadron fired leading german battleships 18 10 one british ships scored 15 inch 38 cm shell hit markgraf shortly thereafter destroyer moresby fired single torpedo markgraf missed range 8 000 yd 7 300 malaya fired torpedo markgraf 19 05 torpedo missed due long range around time markgraf engaged cruiser 2nd light cruiser squadron shifting fire back 5th battle squadron ten minutes period two 15 inch shells hit markgraf though timing unknown hit 18 10 struck joint two 8 inch thick side armor plates shell burst impact holed armor main deck unk approximately 400 390 long tons 440 short tons water entered ship two shells failed explode caused negligible damage
shortly 19 00 german cruiser wiesbaden become disabled shell british battlecruiser invincible rear admiral paul unk könig attempted position four ships cover stricken cruiser simultaneously british iii iv light cruiser squadrons began torpedo attack german line advancing torpedo range smothered wiesbaden fire main guns obsolescent armored cruisers 1st cruiser squadron also joined melee markgraf sisters fired heavily british cruisers even sustained fire battleships main guns failed drive markgraf fired 30 5 cm 15 cm guns armored cruiser defence hail fire german battleships defence exploded sank credit normally given battlecruiser lützow though markgraf gunners also claimed credit sinking

sholay
sholay pronunciation meaning unk 1975 indian hindi language action adventure film directed ramesh sippy produced father g p sippy film follows two criminals veeru jai played dharmendra amitabh bachchan hired retired police officer sanjeev kumar capture ruthless dacoit gabbar singh amjad khan hema malini jaya bhaduri also star veeru jai love interests sholay considered classic one best indian films ranked first british film institute 2002 poll top 10 indian films time 2005 judges 50th annual filmfare awards named best film 50 years

adam stansfield

saprang kalayanamitr
general saprang kalayanamitr thai unk ง กลยาณมตร unk unk unk unk also known unk thai unk big unk thai unk unk unk born 8 july 1948 unk thailand retired officer royal thai army assistant secretary general council national security commander junta 14 000 man anti protest force chairman board directors airports thailand aot also chairman boards tot cat telecom two major thai state owned telecommunication companies

battle tellicherry
battle tellicherry naval action fought indian port tellicherry british french warships 18 november 1791 third anglo mysore war britain france war time engagement french support kingdom mysore conflict british east india company led royal navy patrols stopping searching french ships sailing mysorean port mangalore french convoy mahé passed british port tellicherry november 1791 commodore william cornwallis sent small squadron intercept french ships
british force captain sir richard strachan approached convoy escorting frigate résolue opened fire general action followed strachan succeeding forcing french ship surrender within twenty minutes sides suffering damage casualties french vessels searched subsequently returned mahé local french authorities reacting furiously perceived violation neutral position unk sent back france reporting action commodore saint félix evoked little response although normal circumstances battle might provoked diplomatic incident upheavals ongoing french revolution meant despatches little effect
background
december 1789 five years diplomatic wrangling terms treaty mangalore ended second anglo mysore war ruler mysore tipu sultan declared war british east india company allies southern india next two years war continued british forces allies drove mysore armies back towards capital unk sides reliant supply sea maintain campaigns inland british forces supported major ports bombay madras later unk additional forces small port tellicherry inside mysore territory mysorean forces supplied mangalore french ships france ally tipu sultan father unk ali second anglo mysore war although political instability caused french revolution europe prevented active involvement ensured ships kept supply equipment mysore throughout war

battle
november 1791 french convoy sailed mahé short journey mangalore convoy included two merchant vessels frigate résolue 36 gun warship captain unk passing northwards convoy soon passed tellicherry cornwallis sent strachan phoenix unk stop inspect french ships ensure carrying military supplies smith halted merchant ships sent boats inspect strachan résolue unk french captain placing officer small boat board frigate french captain outraged violation neutrality responded opening fire british sources suggest initial target small boat although phoenix ship immediately damaged
strachan unk french reaction returned fire immediately proximity ships preventing manoeuvres within twenty minutes combat decided french captain unk colours ship battered 60 men wounded dead french ship carried significantly weaker cannon phoenix 6 12 pounder guns 9 18 pounders aboard british squadron addition résolue heavily outnumbered french warships area british three large frigates within sight french losses eventually totalled 25 men killed 60 wounded strachan suffering six killed 11 wounded return

mortimer wheeler
sir robert eric mortimer wheeler ch unk mc unk unk frs unk 10 september 1890 22 july 1976 british archaeologist officer british army course career served director national museum wales london museum director general archaeological survey india founder honorary director institute archaeology london writing twenty four books archaeological subjects
born glasgow middle class family wheeler raised largely yorkshire relocating london teenage years studying classics university college london ucl began working professionally archaeology specializing romano british period world war volunteered service royal artillery stationed western front rose rank major awarded military cross returning britain obtained doctorate ucl taking position national museum wales first keeper archaeology director time oversaw excavation roman forts segontium unk unk augusta aid first wife tessa wheeler unk archaeologist augustus pitt rivers wheeler argued excavation recording unk context required increasingly scientific methodical approach developing wheeler method 1926 appointed keeper london museum oversaw reorganisation collection successfully lobbied increased funding began lecturing ucl
1934 established institute archaeology part federal university london adopting position honorary director period oversaw excavations roman sites lydney park verulamium iron age hill fort maidan castle world war ii joined armed forces rose rank brigadier serving north african campaign allied invasion italy 1944 appointed director general archaeological survey india oversaw excavations sites harappa arikamedu unk implemented reforms subcontinent archaeological establishment returning britain 1948 divided time lecturing institute archaeology acting archaeological adviser pakistan government later life popular books cruise ship lectures appearances radio television particularly bbc series animal unk mineral helped bring archaeology mass audience appointed honorary secretary british academy raised large sums money archaeological projects appointed british representative several unesco projects

species allosaurus
number potential species assigned unk dinosaur genus allosaurus since description 1877 othniel charles marsh handful still regarded valid allosaurus originally described material upper jurassic morrison formation western united states america type species fragilis became one best known species dinosaur

astraeus hygrometricus
astraeus hygrometricus commonly known hygroscopic earthstar barometer earthstar false earthstar species fungus diplocystaceae family young specimens resemble puffball young unk maturity mushroom displays characteristic earthstar shape result outer layer fruit body tissue splitting open star like manner false earthstar ectomycorrhizal species grows association various trees especially sandy soils hygrometricus cosmopolitan distribution common temperate tropical regions common names refer fact hygroscopic water absorbing open rays expose spore sac response increased humidity close drier conditions rays irregularly cracked surface spore case pale brown smooth irregular slit tear top gleba white initially turns brown powdery spores mature spores reddish brown roughly spherical minute warts measuring 7 5 11 unk diameter
despite similar overall appearance hygrometricus related true earthstars genus geastrum although historically unk confused species first described unk unk persoon 1801 geastrum hygrometricus 1885 andrew p morgan proposed differences microscopic characteristics warranted creation new genus astraeus distinct geastrum opinion universally accepted later authorities several asian populations formerly thought hygrometricus renamed 2000s phylogenetic analyses revealed unique astraeus species including asiaticus odoratus research revealed presence several unk chemical compounds fruit bodies north american field guides typically rate hygrometricus inedible

paul thomas anderson
paul thomas anderson born june 26 1970 also known unk anderson american film director screenwriter producer unk film making young age anderson encouraged father ernie anderson disc jockey television radio announcer unk artist become filmmaker
1993 wrote directed short film titled unk coffee budget 20 000 attended sundance institute anderson deal rysher entertainment direct first feature film neo noir crime thriller titled hard eight 1996 anderson received critical commercial success film boogie nights 1997 set golden age unk 1970s 1980s third feature magnolia 1999 received wide acclaim despite struggling box office
2002 romantic comedy drama punch drunk love anderson fourth feature released generally favorable reviews five year absence epic drama blood released critical acclaim 2007 2012 anderson sixth film drama master released critical acclaim seventh film crime comedy drama inherent vice based novel name thomas pynchon released 2014 general acclaim

joe nathan
joseph michael joe nathan born november 22 1974 american professional baseball pitcher chicago cubs major league baseball mlb nathan started baseball career shortstop high school stony brook university converted pitcher drafted san francisco giants worked way minor leagues alternating spots rotation bullpen years splitting time majors minors nathan breakout season setup man giants 2003 offseason nathan traded minnesota twins became closer
2004 2009 nathan considered one top unk mlb four star appearances league leading unk saves 2010 nathan underwent tommy john surgery repair torn ulnar collateral ligament throwing elbow missed entire season april 3 2011 nathan recorded first save since injury toronto blue jays later year july nathan regained role closer august 10 2011 became twins time leader saves unk game boston red sox 2011 season nathan left twins via free agency sign texas rangers becoming star 2012 2013 april 8 2013 earned 300th save 2013 season nathan left rangers via free agency sign detroit tigers nathan currently 8th time saves list

art ross
arthur unk art ross january 13 1885 august 5 1964 canadian professional ice hockey player executive 1905 1954 regarded one best defenders era peers one first skate puck ice rather pass forward stanley cup championship teams twice playing career lasted thirteen seasons january 1907 unk thistles 1908 montreal wanderers like players time ross played several different teams leagues notable time wanderers members national hockey association nha successor national hockey league nhl 1911 led one first organized player strikes increased pay wanderers home arena burned january 1918 team ceased operations ross retired player
several years ice official named head coach hamilton tigers one season boston bruins formed 1924 ross hired first coach general manager team would go coach team three separate occasions 1945 stayed general manager retirement 1954 ross helped bruins finish first place league ten times win stanley cup three times ross personally coached team two victories hired bruins ross along wife two sons moved suburb boston became american citizen 1938 died near boston 1964
outside association bruins ross also helped improve game created style hockey puck still used today advocated improved style goal nets change lasted forty years 1947 ross donated art ross trophy awarded leading scorer nhl regular season ross inducted hockey hall fame 1949
early life

saint leonard catholic church madison nebraska
saint leonard catholic church roman catholic church city madison state nebraska midwestern united states built 1913 described outstanding example romanesque revival style architecture
st leonard parish named saint leonard port maurice organized 1879 wood frame church built 1881 outskirts madison moved city 1898 1902 basement current church built congregation moved converting old church school funds allowed basement extended current brick church completed 1913

portuguese ironclad vasco da gama
vasco da gama central battery ironclad entered service portuguese navy 1876 serving 1935 built thames iron works london launched 1876 completed 1878 served flagship portuguese fleet majority long peaceful career rebuilt heavily modernized 1901 1903 long since obsolete 1930s vasco da gama finally sold scrapping 1935
design
vasco da gama 200 feet 61 long unk beam 40 ft 12 though main battery guns ship 46 ft 6 14 17 wide maximum draft 19 ft 5 8 displaced 2 384 metric tons 2 346 long tons 2 628 short tons originally built fitted unk rig steam engine rated 3 000 indicated horsepower 2 200 kw produced top speed 10 3 kn 19 1 km h 11 9 mph crew 232 officers men
built vasco da gama armed main battery two 10 2 260 mm guns placed individual barbettes side side amidships also equipped single 5 9 150 mm gun mounted stern four 9 pounder guns close range defense torpedo boats protected complete iron armored belt 4 inches 100 mm thick either end 9 230 mm thick amidships main battery guns protected 10 inch 250 mm thick barbettes
service history
vasco da gama laid thames iron works shipyard london britain 1875 launched 1 december 1876 ship completed 1878 served part coastal defense force protected lisbon portuguese capital mouth river unk 26 june 1897 vasco da gama participated fleet review spithead celebrating queen victoria diamond jubilee time ship commanded captain unk de unk
1901 vasco da gama taken unk orlando shipyard unk italy major reconstruction cut half lengthened 32 ft 6 9 91 long section fitted new engines powerful water tube boilers rated 6 000 unk 4 500 kw increased speed 15 5 kn 28 7 km h 17 8 mph sailing rig also removed main battery guns replaced new 8 200 mm l 40 guns unk short 5 9 inch gun replaced new long unk 5 9 inch l 45 gun six 3 pounders augmented close range defense iron belt armor removed stronger steel armor installed place ship crew increased 260 officers men changes caused displacement rise 2 972 metric tons 2 unk long tons 3 276 short tons work vasco da gama completed 1903

toniná
unk toniná spanish unk pre columbian archaeological site ruined city maya civilization located mexican state chiapas 13 km 8 1 mi east town ocosingo

shaoguan incident
shaoguan incident civil disturbance took place overnight 25 26 june 2009 guangdong province china violent dispute erupted migrant uyghurs han workers toy factory shaoguan result allegations sexual assault han female groups han set upon uyghur co workers leading least two uyghurs killed uyghur workers witnessed incident report least 100 dead 400 wounded 118 people injured
event widely cited trigger event july 2009 ürümqi riots ostensibly started peaceful street protest demanding official action two uyghurs died shaoguan following trials october 2009 one person executed several others sentenced terms life imprisonment five seven years

galveston texas
galveston unk coastal city located galveston island pelican island us state texas community 208 3 square miles 539 km2 population 47 762 people 2012 census estimate county seat second largest municipality galveston county located within houston woodlands sugar land metropolitan area
named bernardo de gálvez madrid count gálvez born unk spain galveston first european settlements island constructed around 1816 french pirate louis michel aury help fledgling republic mexico fight spain port galveston established 1825 congress mexico following successful independence spain city served main port texas navy texas revolution later served capital republic texas
19th century galveston became major us commercial center one largest ports united states devastated 1900 galveston hurricane whose effects included flooding storm surge natural disaster exposed barrier island still ranked deadliest united states history estimated toll 8 000 people
much galveston modern economy centered tourism health care shipping financial industries 84 acre 340 000 m2 university texas medical branch campus enrollment 2 500 students major economic force city galveston home six historic districts containing one largest historically significant collections 19th century buildings united states 60 structures listed national register historic places

mutinus elegans
mutinus elegans commonly known elegant stinkhorn dog stinkhorn headless stinkhorn devil unk species fungus unk family saprobic species typically found growing ground singly small groups woody debris leaf litter summer autumn japan europe eastern north america fruit body begins development egg form resembling somewhat puffball partially submerged ground fungus matures slender orange pink colored stalk emerges tapers evenly pointed tip stalk covered foul smelling unk green spore mass upper third length flies insects feed upon unk contains spores assisting dispersal due repellent odor mature specimens generally considered edible although reports immature eggs consumed laboratory mutinus elegans shown inhibit growth several microorganisms pathogenic humans
taxonomy
mutinus elegans first described british missionary john unk 1679 chronicled natural history virginia early report thought first account fungus north america first characterized scientifically french scientist jean pierre françois camille montagne 1856 called unk elegans genus name mutinus refers phallic deity mutinus unk one roman di unk unk roman unk species commonly known variously elegant stinkhorn headless stinkhorn dog stinkhorn devil unk specific epithet elegans derived latin word meaning graceful elegant

edward creutz
edward creutz january 23 1913 june 27 2009 american physicist worked manhattan project metallurgical laboratory los alamos laboratory world war ii war became professor physics carnegie institute technology vice president research general atomics 1955 1970 published 65 papers unk physics mathematics metallurgy science policy held 18 patents relating nuclear energy
graduate university wisconsin madison creutz helped princeton university build first cyclotron world war ii worked nuclear reactor design eugene wigner metallurgical laboratory designing cooling system first water cooled reactors led group studied metallurgy uranium elements used reactor designs october 1944 moved los alamos laboratory became group leader
war ended creutz accepted offer come carnegie institute technology became head physics department nuclear research center 1948 1955 returned los alamos evaluate thermonuclear fusion program atomic energy commission accepted offer become vice president research development director john jay hopkins laboratory pure applied science general atomics leadership general atomics developed triga nuclear reactor universities laboratories
creutz served assistant director national science foundation 1970 1977 director unk unk bishop museum honolulu took particular interest museum preparation manual unk unk hawaii

79 wing raaf
79 wing royal australian air force raaf wing world war ii formed december 1943 batchelor northern territory part north western area command unk group captain charles eaton wing comprised four squadrons establishment flying beaufort b 25 mitchell bombers beaufighter heavy fighters 79 wing took part new guinea north western area campaigns 1944 45 eventually transferring unk dutch east indies allies advanced northward end pacific war wing attached australian first tactical air force made nos 2 18 netherlands east indies squadrons flying mitchells latter transferred netherlands air force late 1945 former returned australia disbanded following year 79 headquarters disbanded october 1945 soon end hostilities
history
79 wing established batchelor northern territory 30 november 1943 combat units consisted nos 1 2 squadrons flying beaufort light reconnaissance bombers 31 squadron beaufighter long range fighters 18 netherlands east indies squadron b 25 mitchell medium bombers wing commanded group captain charles eaton whose dutch personnel called unk charles uncle charles operating auspices north western area command nwa darwin 79 wing participated new guinea north western area campaigns 1944
march april 1944 beaufighters attacked japanese shipping mitchells beauforts bombed timor daily basis prelude operations unk unk invasions hollandia aitape eaton organised large raid su dutch timor 19 april unk thirty five mitchells beauforts beaufighters force destroyed town barracks fuel dumps result earned personal congratulations air officer commanding nwa air vice marshal king cole day allied landings 22 april mitchells beaufighters made daylight raid dili portuguese timor ground assault hollandia aitape met little opposition credited part air bombardment leading
may 1944 nos 1 18 31 squadrons attacked japanese positions timor 2 squadron withdrawn combat equip mitchells 79 wing light medium bombers suffered lack suitable targets airfields forward areas refuel 2 squadron returned operations mitchells june month 18 squadron flew 149 sorties damaging japanese airfields shipping timor area lost commanding officer anti aircraft fire raid

fern hobbs
fern hobbs may 8 1883 april 10 1964 american attorney us state oregon private secretary oregon governor oswald west noted ambition several accomplishments young woman became highest paid woman public service america mid twenties
hobbs made international news governor west sent implement martial law small eastern oregon town copperfield event considered strategic coup west establishing state authority remote rural community unk reputation proponent prohibition
hobbs later worked american red cross europe oregon journal newspaper died portland 1964
early life
hobbs born may 8 1883 unk nebraska john alden hobbs unk bush hobbs family moved salt lake city utah six years old lived 12 years finishing high school father met financial difficulties moved oregon settling hillsboro put younger brother sister school studying unk working living
soon became private secretary president title unk trust company bank held many assets oregon common school fund failed hobbs time ben unk secretary state member state land board charged protecting common school fund involved negotiating failing bank state assets took note hobbs strong loyalty employer
bank failure hobbs worked governess j wesley unk brother william unk portland also helped raise younger brother sister studied unk law worked secretary 1913 hobbs graduated unk university college law bachelor laws degree admitted oregon state bar
unk managed oswald west successful 1910 campaign become governor oregon recommended west hire hobbs private stenographer hired impressed west point hired private secretary two years later time age 27 highest paid woman public service united states earning 3 000 per year

unk stephen

hurricane omar 2008
hurricane omar strong hurricane took unusual southwest northeast track eastern caribbean sea october 2008 forming tropical disturbance october 13 omar initially moved slowly eastern caribbean sea october 15 omar began quickly intensify deep convection developed around center circulation later day eye developed storm began accelerate northeast early october 16 omar reached peak intensity winds 130 mph 215 km h barometric pressure unk mbar hpa 28 29 inhg shortly hurricane rapidly weakened category 1 intensity slightly strengthening next day omar weakened tropical storm degenerating non convective low pressure area remnants omar persisted october 21 time dissipated west azores
throughout eastern caribbean omar affected numerous islands recorded minor impacts large swells heavy rains impacted abc islands antigua barbuda sustained 54 million damages mainly antigua nine homes destroyed several others damaged many farms inundated flood waters one person died puerto rico suffering stress induced cardiac arrest united states virgin islands also sustained significant damage costing roughly 6 million numerous boats homes damaged 100 power poles snapped total losses storm estimated 79 million

september 30 well developed tropical wave moved eastern coast africa entered atlantic ocean deep convection formed around prominent mid level circulation moved towards west however convection diminished october 2 entering caribbean sea week later upon entering caribbean sea shower thunderstorm activity redeveloped around low continued development followed low designated tropical depression fifteen 0600 utc october 13 located 190 miles 305 kilometres south southeastern tip dominican republic previous steady westward motion system took across atlantic halted entered area weak steering currents significant motion expected another day two structure storm improved upgraded tropical storm national hurricane center nhc gave name omar
located southeast broad deep tropospheric trough west low mid level ridge omar took counter clockwise turn october 14 upon becoming tropical storm omar began undergo extended period rapid intensification deep convection developed around center circulation wind shear around storm previously inhibiting quick development weakened allowing strengthening later day 11 5 17 2 mi 18 5 27 7 km wide eye formed storm began turn towards northeast due trough formation eye dvorak technique rendered intensity 75 mph 120 km h signifying omar intensified hurricane intensification briefly stalled eyewall eroded center storm became slightly elliptical however deep convection persisted strengthening forecast storm neared puerto rico shortly eye quickly became well defined appeared visible satellite images indication storm intensifying chances rapid intensification good storm featured well developed outflow prominent banding features
warm sea surface temperatures high ocean heat content low wind shear moist air mass omar quickly reached peak intensity early october 16 category 4 hurricane winds 130 mph 215 km h intensification phase forward motion hurricane increased 20 mph 32 km h atlantic ocean omar began rapidly weaken winds decreasing 50 mph 85 km h 12 hours visible satellite images depicted exposed low level circulation convection displaced east due combination high wind shear dry air october 17 deep convection associated system dissipated however brief decrease wind shear allowed omar strengthen secondary peak winds 85 mph 140 km h phase convection redeveloped around center eye reformed later day trough caused rapid northeastern motion bypassed omar leading decreasing movement
weakening storm omar continued towards northeast due mid upper level ridge located south system mid latitude westerlies north late october 17 wind shear increased omar tracked waters 26 c 79 f around 0000 utc october 18 omar weakened tropical storm deep convection associated dissipated twelve hours later still producing tropical storm force winds storm degenerated remnant low pressure area remnants omar persisted 0600 utc october 21 dissipated 805 mi 1 295 km west azores

first move advantage chess
first move advantage chess inherent advantage player white makes first move chess chess players theorists generally agree white begins game advantage since 1851 compiled statistics support view white consistently wins slightly often black usually scoring 52 56 percent white winning percentage tournament games humans games computers however white advantage less significant unk games games unk
chess players unk long debated whether given perfect play sides game end win white draw since approximately 1889 world champion wilhelm unk addressed issue overwhelming consensus perfectly played game would end draw however notable players argued white advantage may sufficient force win weaver adams unk unk claimed white winning first move 1e4 hans berliner argued 1d4 may win white
players including world champions josé unk capablanca emanuel lasker bobby fischer expressed fears draw death chess becomes deeply analyzed alleviate danger capablanca fischer proposed chess variants renew interest game lasker suggested changing draws stalemate scored
since 1988 chess theorists challenged previously well established views white advantage grandmaster gm unk adorján wrote series books theme black ok arguing general perception white advantage founded psychology reality gm mihai suba others contend sometimes white initiative disappears apparent reason game progresses prevalent style play black today seek dynamic unk positions active unk rather merely trying equalize

drawn best play
joseph bertin wrote unk textbook noble game chess plays first understood attack consistent traditional view white virtue first move begins initiative try extend unk black strive neutralize white initiative attain equality white begins initiative minor mistake white generally leads loss initiative similar mistake black may serious consequences thus sveshnikov wrote 1994 black players cannot afford make even slightest mistake theoretical point view tasks white black chess different white strive win black draw
chess theorists long debated enduring white initiative whether sides play perfectly game end win white draw george walker wrote 1846 first move advantage properly answered first move little worth unk first world champion widely considered father modern chess wrote 1889 conceded experts proper play sides legitimate issue game ought draw lasker capablanca second third world champions agreed unk fine one world leading players 1936 1951 wrote white opening advantage unk sufficient win without error black
view game chess end draw given best play prevails even cannot proved assumption considered safe rowson logical adorján watson agrees proper result perfectly played chess game draw course prove doubt find single strong player would disagree remember kasparov last round draw explaining waiting reporters well chess draw world champion bobby fischer thought almost definitely

frederick reines

krak des chevaliers
krak des chevaliers french pronunciation unk unk de unk arabic حصن unk also crac des chevaliers unk al akrād حصن unk castle unk formerly crac de l ospital crusader castle syria one important preserved medieval castles world site first inhabited 11th century settlement kurdish troops dispatched unk result known hisn al akrad meaning castle kurds 1142 given raymond ii count tripoli knights hospitaller remained possession fell 1271 became known crac de l ospital name krak des chevaliers coined 19th century

etymology
modern arabic word castle unk unk krak des unk known unk حصن fort derives name earlier fortification site called unk al akrād حصن unk meaning fort kurds called franks le unk confusion unk fortress le crac unk probably frankish version akrād word kurds knights hospitaller took control castle became known crac de l ospital name crac des chevaliers alternatively spelt krak des chevaliers introduced guillaume rey 19th century
location

translation

lloyd mathews
sir lloyd william mathews unk cb 7 march 1850 11 october 1901 british naval officer politician abolitionist mathews joined royal navy cadet age 13 progressed ranks lieutenant involved third anglo unk war 1873 4 afterwards stationed east africa suppression slave trade 1877 seconded navy sultan barghash zanzibar order form european style army would remain employment government zanzibar rest life army quickly reached 6 300 men used several expeditions suppress slave trade rebellions zanzibar government
mathews retired royal navy 1881 appointed brigadier general zanzibar followed expeditions african mainland including failed attempt stop german expansion east africa october 1891 mathews appointed first minister zanzibar government position unk sultan time mathews keen abolitionist promoted cause sultans worked resulted prohibiting slave trade zanzibar dominions 1890 abolition slavery 1897 mathews appointed british consul general east africa 1891 declined take position remaining zanzibar instead mathews troops also played key role ending anglo zanzibar war 1896 erupted attempt bypass requirement new sultans must unk british consul time first minister mathews continued involved military part two large campaigns one witu another mwele
mathews decorated several governments receiving appointments companion order st michael st george companion order bath knight commander order st michael st george british government membership prussian order crown zanzibar also rewarded member grand order unk first class member order brilliant star zanzibar mathews died malaria zanzibar 11 october 1901
early life career
mathews born unk madeira 7 march 1850 father captain william matthews welsh mother jane wallis penfold daughter william penfold sarah gilbert sister augusta jane unk née penfold author famous book flora fauna madeira natural history museum mathews became cadet royal navy 1863 appointed unk 23 september 1866 1868 stationed mediterranean first active service third anglo unk war 1873 4 qualified campaign medal promoted lieutenant 31 march 1874 27 august 1875 mathews posted hms london depot ship royal navy headquarters east africa assist suppression slave trade area whilst unk drilled troops captured several slave unk commended actions admiralty
commander chief zanzibar
august 1877 mathews seconded navy sultan barghash zanzibar form european style army could used enforce zanzibar control mainland possessions army traditionally composed entirely arabs persians mathews opened recruitment african majority island 300 recruits training end year addition mathews employed unorthodox recruitment methods purchasing slaves masters using inmates prison recruiting africans rescued unk june 1877 instigation john kirk explorer friend sultan british government sent shipment 500 modern rifles ammunition gift arm troops mathews introduced new uniform troops consisting red cap short black jackets white trousers enlisted ranks dark blue unk coats trousers gold silver unk arab officers latter possibly modelled royal navy officers uniform familiar army grew quickly 1880s mathews would command 1 300 men forces eventually numbering 1 000 regulars 5 000 unk
one first tasks new army suppress smuggling slaves unk mainland island pemba north zanzibar troops completed mission capturing several unk hindering trade mathews retired royal navy june 1881 appointed brigadier general zanzibar 1880 sultan dispatched military force mathews bring unruly african mainland territories control mathews expedition initially intended reach unk men refused march inland made deserted large numbers expedition ended instead unk 60 man garrison established reduced mere handful men mid 1880s expedition proved sultan serious maintaining control possessions mathews men also involved several expeditions halt land based slave trade developed seas became heavily unk traders
1881 mathews old vessel hms london captained charles j brownrigg vessel crew made several patrols aimed hindering slave trade using smaller steam boats actual unk captures december 3 1881 caught slave dhow captained hindi bin unk dhow around 100 slaves board transporting pemba zanzibar captain brownrigg led boarding party release slaves bin unk men attacked sailors killing brownrigg party sailing away mathews led force unk pemba short battle took mortally wounded bin unk prisoner returning zanzibar
mathews returned african mainland territories 1884 landed force intended establish garrisons dissuade german territorial claims attempt ultimately failed five german warships steamed zanzibar town harbour threatened sultan signing away territories would later form german east africa territories ceded german east africa company 1888 unrest amongst locals prevented taking control mathews dispatched 100 men restore order finding around 8 000 people gathered german administrators mathews forced return men zanzibar landed troops found subject death threats troops would obey orders returned zanzibar
first minister
october 1891 upon formation first constitutional government zanzibar mathews appointed first minister despite hostility sultan ali bin said capacity mathews unk sultan unk sultan british consul position strong one missionary island quoted saying powers defied analytical examination mathews really could say l état est unk state mathews also known strong man zanzibar principal departments government mostly run britons british indians mathews approval required could removed office mathews rewarded zanzibar government role appointment first class member order brilliant star zanzibar granted licence queen victoria accept wear 17 may 1886 mathews used position suppress slavery country 1889 convinced sultan issue decree purchasing freedom slaves taken refuge dominions 1890 prohibiting slave trade 1 february 1891 mathews appointed majesty commissioner consul general british unk influence east africa never took post instead chose remain zanzibar
mathews rewarded service zanzibar british government appointed companion order st michael st george 1880 companion order bath 24 may 1889 despite becoming renowned east africa man ran fair administration strict criminals unk effective british rule halting slave trade led arabs petition sultan removal 1892 1893 mathews purchased island unk government intended used prison never housed prisoners instead used quarantine yellow fever cases present use conservation area giant unk mathews appointed knight commander order st michael st george 1894 also awarded membership order crown german government
matters came head khalid bin barghash attempted take control palace zanzibar town upon death uncle august 1896 despite failing gain consent british consul mathews opposed succession british agreement called 900 soldiers attempt prevent situation eventually led anglo zanzibar war mathews support admiral harry rawson five vessels royal navy bombarded palace secured end khalid administration mathews helped arrange succession pro british sultan unk bin mohammed khalid successor mathews continued reforms war abolishing slavery 1897 establishing new farms grow produce using western techniques appointed member grand order unk zanzibar permitted accept wear decoration 25 august 1897
military expeditions
mwele
addition smaller scale expeditions described earlier mathews embarked two much larger expeditions african mainland tenure first minister first mwele initial rebellion area led mbaruk bin rashid gazi mathews put 1 200 men 1882 however 1895 mbaruk nephew mbaruk bin rashid refused acknowledge appointment new leader unk led open rebellion unk february year younger mbaruk attacked zanzibari troops arthur unk one mathews officers mathews part anglo zanzibari expedition sent quell consisted 310 british sailors 50 royal marines 54 sudanese 164 zanzibari troops unk destroyed leaders fled gazi older mbaruk failed turn another force admiral rawson 400 british marines sailors sent expedition failed capture unk third expedition organised rawson 220 sailors 80 marines 60 sudanese 50 unk destroyed mwele latter action mathews wounded shoulder
witu
following death german unk operating illegally sultan zanzibar british government dispatched expedition 20 october 1890 bring sultan witu justice nine warships three transports carrying 800 sailors marines 150 imperial british east africa company ibea indian police 200 zanzibari 50 sudanese troops sent defeating sultan establishing british protectorate ibea given control area established force 250 indian police maintain peace police withdrawn july 1893 following threats violence new sultan witu oman another expedition dispatched region consisted three warships hms blanche hms unk zanzibari ship unk unk latter carried mathews 125 unk 50 sudanese brigadier general unk zanzibar army
mathews escort force went witu 31 july removed flag ibea company replaced red flag zanzibar destroying several villages causing oman retreat forests british troops withdrew suffered heavily malaria sudanese zanzibari troops remained expedition sent 140 sailors 85 troops oman died soon unk sultan omar bin unk appointed govern behalf zanzibar bringing affair close return action mathews received british east west africa campaign medal

hms boreas unk
hms boreas b class destroyer built royal navy around 1930 initially assigned mediterranean fleet transferred home fleet 1936 ship patrolled spanish waters enforcing arms blockade first year spanish civil war 1936 39 spent world war ii convoy escort duties english channel north atlantic based dover gibraltar freetown sierra leone boreas also served two brief tours mediterranean fleet participated operation unk 1943 allied invasion sicily loaned royal hellenic navy next year conversion escort destroyer renamed salamis served aegean rest war salamis became training ship war returned britain scrapped 1951

new york state route 368

route description
ny 368 began intersection ny 321 adjacent carpenter brook fish unk town elbridge route headed north halfway road passing farmland headed rural area onondaga county small hamlet halfway ny 368 served small number homes crossed unk railroad line part finger lakes railway center community outside halfway route turned northwest toward village elbridge avoiding marshy area directly north halfway intersected lynch road campbell road turning slightly northward following carpenter brook another undeveloped area intersection ny 5 east village ny 368 ended
history

curtis woodhouse
curtis woodhouse born 17 april 1980 english former professional footballer turned professional boxer football manager recently manager hull united woodhouse played football central midfielder competed light welterweight boxer former british light welterweight champion career football league spanned across nine seasons earning four caps england 21 football team woodhouse professional boxing record stands 29 fights 22 wins 13 knock 7 defeats
started unk career york city centre excellence joining sheffield united november 2001 transferred birmingham city fee 1 million joining rotherham united january 2003 loan five months joined peterborough united free transfer october 2003 may 2005 joined hull city 25 000 joining grimsby town eight months later january 2006 retired end 2006 07 season
woodhouse stated fallen love football decided turn professional boxing despite previous experience september 2006 first professional boxing match defeating dean marcantonio points knocking twice final round defeat jay morris april 2009 losing 37 36 points
convicted assaulting police officer using threatening abusive insulting words behaviour april 2006 result boxing licence suspended five months british boxing board control despite incident happening unk jurisdiction woodhouse returned football november 2006 joining rushden diamonds conference national moving mansfield town january 2009 leaving moved harrogate town end february 2010 joined sheffield northern premier league start 2011 12 football season moved two divisions football league system joined conference north outfit eastwood town

thom darden
thomas vincent darden born august 28 1950 former american football cornerback safety punt unk played cleveland browns national football league nfl nfl three time pro free safety earned pro bowl selection 1978 holds cleveland browns franchise interception records american defensive back michigan wolverines football team made one memorable interceptions college football history retiring football darden pursued careers sports agent security provider business consultant
early life
darden born unk ohio graduated unk high school
college football

chris turner american football

florida state road 878

route description

james nesbitt
william james nesbitt obe born 15 january 1965 actor presenter northern ireland born ballymena county antrim nesbitt grew nearby village unk moving coleraine county unk wanted become teacher like father began degree french university ulster dropped year decided become actor transferred central school speech drama london graduating 1987 spent seven years performing plays varied musical roof 1987 1989 political drama paddywack 1994 made feature film debut playing talent agent unk donnell hear song 1991
nesbitt got breakthrough television role playing adam williams romantic comedy drama cold feet 1998 2003 british comedy award television radio industries club award national television award first significant film role came appeared pig farmer pig finn waking ned 1998 rest starring cast nesbitt nominated screen actors guild award lucky break 2001 made debut film lead playing prisoner jimmy hands next year played ivan cooper television film bloody sunday 1972 shootings derry departure previous unk unk roles film turning point career british independent film award nominated british academy television award best actor
nesbitt also starred murphy law 2001 2007 undercover detective tommy murphy role created writer colin bateman role twice gained nesbitt best actor nominations irish film television awards ifta 2007 starred dual role tom jackman mr hyde steven moffat jekyll earned golden globe award nomination 2008 nesbitt since appeared several dramatic roles starred alongside liam neeson five minutes heaven 2009 one three lead actors television miniseries occupation 2009 also starred movies unk 2010 way 2010 portrayed unk peter jackson three part film adaptation hobbit 2012 2014
nesbitt married former actress sonia forbes adam two daughters advocate numerous charities 2010 accepted ceremonial position chancellor university ulster

moro river campaign
moro river campaign important battle italian campaign second world war fought elements british eighth army lxxvi panzer corps lxxvi unk german 10th army 10 unk unk 4 26 december 1943 campaign occurred primarily vicinity moro river eastern italy campaign designed part offensive launched general sir harold alexander allied 15th army group intention breaching german army winter line defensive system advancing pescara eventually rome
beginning 4 december four infantry divisions one british one canadian one indian one new zealand included armoured brigade two armoured brigades one british one canadian v corps xiii corps attacked heavily defended german positions along moro river achieving several unk unk 8 december throughout next week nearly continuous combat operations sides designed keep one another pinned created unk defensive positions near orsogna narrow pit known gully held gully 10 days canadians succeeded outflanking german defences forcing german withdrawal ortona orsogna line 20 december line attacked corps
26 december strong german defences stalled canadian forces ortona british new zealand forces orsogna although ortona villa grande captured end december general exhaustion among allied forces prevented capture orsogna advance pescara harsh winter weather set became clear allied generals progress would made alexander called offensive
background
late 1943 15th army group general sir harold alexander fighting way northward italy determined german opposition commanded unk albert kesselring whose forces prepared succession defensive lines east unk mountain spine british eighth army general bernard montgomery october eighth army crossed unk river pushed german defenders volturno unk line defences unk logistical problems able attack next line defences barbara line behind unk river 2 november however 9 november forward elements eighth army contact forward defences german winter line set high ground north unk river
main attack across unk v corps lieutenant general charles unk comprising british 78th infantry division major general unk unk 8th indian infantry division major general dudley russell supporting diversionary attacks inland 2nd new zealand division lieutenant general bernard freyberg xiii corps lieutenant general miles c dempsey delayed bad weather late november several days hard fighting germans withdrew defences prepared high ground north moro river
offensive strategy order battle
moro river runs central mountain spine italy adriatic coast south ortona german defences moro centerpiece winter line guarded eastern side unk along route 5 montgomery hoped punch winter line capture ortona pescara advance rome 78th infantry division unk v corps since volturno line actions sustained 7 000 casualties less six months relieved fresh 1st canadian infantry division major general chris vokes ready renew offensive 5 december 1943 78th infantry division sent mountains relatively quiet left wing army joining british 5th infantry division major general gerard unk xiii corps

canadian division across moro
6 december 1943 canadian forces began series large scale assaults major crossing points along moro river objective securing large bridgehead along defensive line three primary points attack chosen villa rogatti along western edge canadian sector san leonardo 5 km 3 1 mi south ortona san donato small town near italian coast five primary infantry battalions selected assault positions objective crossing moro river offensives scheduled start morning 6 december
villa rogatti
task taking villa rogatti westernmost crossing point given princess patricia canadian light infantry ppcli conducted reconnaissance objective night 5 december 1943 attack plan devised battalion commander lieutenant colonel cameron bethel ware detailing objectives four rifle companies objectives secured early morning 6 december anglo canadian reinforcements moved villa rogatti intention unk expected potentially strong german counterattacks elements three german regiments 200th 361st panzergrenadier 26th panzer maintained strong defences within town
00 00 5 december two companies ppcli crossed moro river moving towards villa rogatti within hour vicious fighting erupted throughout town two companies canadian infantry struggled break german defensive lines b company broke german defences company attacked northeast continuing engage 200th panzergrenadier regiment 200 panzergrenadier unk regiment near villa rogatti although two canadian infantry companies occupied villa rogatti german panzergrenadier forces still maintained substantial defences outskirts town however c company continued advance steadily along eastern side town encountering significant resistance 361st panzergrenadier regiment 361 panzergrenadier regiment approximately hour fighting c companies villa rogatti occupied canadian forces shortly dawn
mid morning german counterattacks ppcli positions town begun involving tanks 7th company 26th panzer regiment 26 panzer regiment field guns substantial infantry forces throughout afternoon two infantry companies ppcli fought several attacks german forces eventually managing push back vineyards northern edge town ppcli taken 68 casualties german casualties estimated 120 however three strong german formation surrounded canadian positions villa rogatti rendering exploitation bridgehead unlikely col ware advised ready withdraw across moro river german forces counterattack order allow canadian division greater concentration force night 7 8 december indian 21st infantry brigade indian 8th infantry division amalgamated western flank 1st canadian division lines result withdrawal canadian efforts would focus achieving bridgehead san leonardo
san leonardo

afternoon failed capture san leonardo hastings prince edward regiment sent two rifle companies aid seaforth highlanders seaforth b company attacked positions west san leonardo inflicting 129 casualties german forces area however attack san leonardo three seaforth companies stalled rapidly 26th panzer regiment armoured companies reinforced sector result unk ordered prepare withdrawal san leonardo bridgehead

taking moro
8 december 1943 major general vokes devised new plan taking moro river 48th highlanders canada princess patricia canadian light infantry resumed assault san leonardo southwest side town royal canadian regiment rcr would break bridgehead created hastings prince edward regiment move southwest towards san leonardo link 48th ppcli operation scheduled start afternoon 8 december

gully
initial attacks
following loss san leonardo moro river 90th panzergrenadier division withdrew primary defensive line 5 km 3 1 mi north san leonardo line centred around natural ravine known gully average depth 200 ft 61 general vokes initial plan take position well achieve foothold roads toward ortona consisted frontal assault 2nd canadian infantry brigade would seize unk ridge capture gully gain positions ortona orsogna road however german defences adequately prepared including gun pits bunkers shelters
10 december three canadian battalions made first attempt cross gully although succeeded capturing unk ridge directly south gully attempts unk german positions ravine unsuccessful 11 december three battalions made another attempt loyal edmonton regiment suffering heavy casualties attempts take german positions sector although badly unk company able gain foothold reverse slope newly arrived german units forced remaining men withdraw
12 december 1943 general vokes sent three battalions 3rd canadian infantry brigade german defences gully assault started poorly canadian artillery plans captured soldiers 90th panzergrenadier division 200th regiment west nova scotia regiment attacked gully subject counterattacks 200th panzergrenadier regiment approximately 10 30 14 00 regiment called attacks taken heavy casualties west princess patricia canadian light infantry fared little better c company taking heavy casualties assault attempts made 13 december two battalions 3rd canadian infantry brigade attacks driven back unk german resistance evening 13 december heavily depleted 90th panzergrenadier division relieved positions gully units 1st parachute division
casa berardi

ortona
throughout week 11 18 december 1st parachute battalion german 1st parachute division supporting units prepared strong defences within italian coastal town ortona unk engineers infantry destroyed much ortona turning streets debris filled maze major streets mined demolition charges throughout main unk booby traps littered town german forces also buried tanks rubble leaving turrets exposed

aftermath
ortona villa grande captured looked would require eighth army unk strike one concentrated blow orsogna complete breaching gustav line main adriatic unk however 31 december v corps unk along coastal plain towards pescara unk enveloped battlefield drifting snow unk biting winds unk movement communications ground cloud ceiling visibility fell nil grounded unk montgomery realising eighth army longer strength conditions force way pescara via valeria rome recommended general alexander eighth army offensive halted alexander agreed ordered maintain aggressive patrolling order pin units lxxvi panzer corps adriatic sector prevent kesselring moving reinforce xiv panzer corps front opposite mark clark us fifth army allied offensive would continue

berkley bedell
berkley warren bedell born march 5 1921 former us representative iowa starting successful business youth berkley fly co ran united states congress 1972 defeated incumbent wiley mayne 1974 however bedell beat wiley mayne elected congress
known support representative democracy populist style example would hold town halls let constituents vote motions decide would congress behalf meetings helped bedell understand problems constituents result backed issues important farming constituency waterway usage fees production constraints
seek reelection 1986 contracting unk disease tick bite though longer serves congress bedell remains active iowa politics strongly supporting howard dean 2004 john kerry 2008 presidential election met several times chris dodd endorsed barack obama end
early life
born spirit lake iowa bedell educated spirit lake public schools graduated spirit lake high school 1939 earned spending money business midst great depression business involved unk dog hairs around unk result could sold trout flies began tying fly fishing unk bedroom moved business parents basement time got space grocery store continue business full time
graduating high school attended iowa state university 1940 1942 met fellow unk student elinor unk grand unk minnesota berkley elinor married minneapolis august 29 1943 son kenneth born 1947 thomas 1950 daughter unk 1952 berkley college personal life interrupted 1942 joined army served united states army first lieutenant flight trainer 1942 1945 got back began garner success fish tackling business business became larger hundreds employees international operations become millionaire 1960s served member spirit lake board education 1957 1962

leslie andrew
brigadier leslie unk andrew vc dso 23 march 1897 8 january 1969 senior officer new zealand military forces recipient victoria cross highest award british commonwealth gallantry face enemy received decoration actions battle passchendaele 1917
born 1897 andrew joined new zealand expeditionary force 1915 gained military experience serving territorial force served western front september 1916 early 1918 ended war commissioned officer england remained military cessation hostilities joined new zealand staff corps held staff administrative positions new zealand officer exchange program british india
following outbreak second world war andrew appointed commander 22nd battalion led battles greece crete early part north african campaign short period late 1941 commanded infantry brigade 2nd new zealand division received distinguished service order leadership returned new zealand 1942 commanded wellington fortress area remainder war retired military 1952 rank brigadier died 1969 aged 71
early life
leslie andrew born 23 march 1897 unk unk region new zealand son local school headmaster grew unk father moved family taken position area educated unk collegiate school leaving school employed new zealand railways department clerk participated cadet program school later joined territorial force 1915 promoted sergeant sat necessary exams become commissioned officer unk
military career
first world war
andrew volunteered new zealand expeditionary force nzef october 1915 men ages 19 45 required register service nzef falsified age ensure would eligible duty overseas member 12th reinforcements embarked western front via egypt 1 may 1916 france posted b company wellington infantry battalion rank private
andrew arrival front coincided start somme offensive participated battle unk unk began 15 september wounded promoted corporal january 1917 took part battle unk following june

unk period
england andrew met unk ball nottingham married 12 november 1918 couple five children although one died infancy upon discharge nzef august 1919 joined new zealand staff corps served number administrative positions next several years 1927 1929 served highland light infantry british india officer exchange program return new zealand appointed adjutant 1st wellington regiment 1937 promoted captain commanded new zealand contingent sent london coronation king george vi queen elizabeth
second world war
following outbreak second world war andrew seconded 2nd new zealand expeditionary force early 1940 appointed commander 22nd battalion forming unk military camp near wellington trained new command hard quickly earned nickname february due habit issuing 28 day unk breaches discipline
battalion embarked england may 1940 part 5th infantry brigade 2nd new zealand division arriving june spent remainder year garrison duties south england march 1941 travelled egypt onto greece andrew led battalion subsequent battle greece saw little action battle crete
crete battalion tasked defence unk airfield overlooking hill point 107 andrew ordered maintain control positions costs forced disperse companies battalion widely cover positions lost contact units german paratroopers began landing area 20 may unk receive support brigade commander following request assistance fearing command overrun failed counterattack small reserve withdrew remaining units happened forward companies remained intact subsequently able withdraw finding abandoned andrew criticised withdrawal led loss unk airfield significant factor allowing german forces become established crete surviving elements battalion later evacuated crete
despite setback crete andrew remained commander 22nd battalion early phases north african campaign one stage temporary commander 5th infantry brigade nominal commander brigadier james unk captured late november 1941 andrew awarded distinguished service order leadership brigade deal repeated attacks german forces early december relinquished command 22nd battalion 3 february 1942 returned new zealand promoted full colonel commanded wellington fortress area rest war
later life
andrew commanded new zealand contingent 1946 victory parade london following year attended imperial defence college promoted brigadier 1948 appointed commander central military district remained capacity retirement military 1952 andrew later invited run parliament declined died 8 january 1969 aged 71 buried full military honours ceremony levin unk cemetery levin

1940 atlantic hurricane season generally average period tropical cyclogenesis 1940 though season official bounds tropical cyclone activity occurred august september throughout year fourteen tropical cyclones formed nine reached tropical storm intensity six hurricanes none hurricanes reached major hurricane intensity tropical cyclones approach populated areas shipping lanes especially relatively weak short duration may remained undetected technologies satellite monitoring available 1960s historical data tropical cyclones period often reliable result reanalysis project analyzed season 2012 additional hurricane added hurdat year first tropical storm formed may 19 northern coast hispaniola time rare occurrence four tropical disturbances known formed prior period since reanalysis previous seasons concluded four tropical cyclones may 1940 season final system tropical disturbance situated greater antilles dissipated november 8

hurricane two
august 3 extratropical cyclone developed tropical depression west coast florida initially weak disturbance moved generally westward slowly gaining intensity early august 4 depression attained tropical storm intensity ships vicinity storm reported much stronger tropical cyclone initially suggested reaching hurricane strength august 5 south mississippi river delta storm strengthened modern day category 2 hurricane maximum sustained winds 100 mph minimum barometric pressure 972 mbar hpa 28 71 inhg 0600 utc august 7 hurricane moved ashore near sabine pass texas later day peak strength inland storm executed sharp curve north quickly weakened degenerating tropical storm august 8 dissipating arkansas august 10

ode nightingale

poem
heart unk unk unk pains
sense though hemlock drunk
emptied dull unk drains
one minute past unk wards sunk
unk envy thy happy lot 5
happy unk happiness
thou light unk unk trees
unk plot
unk green shadows unk
unk summer full throated ease 10
draught vintage hath
cool long age deep unk earth
unk flora country green
dance unk song unk unk
unk full warm south 15
full true unk unk
unk bubbles unk unk
purple unk mouth
might drink leave world unseen
thee fade away forest dim 20
unk far away dissolve quite forget
thou among leaves unk never known
weariness fever fret
men sit hear unk
unk shakes sad last grey hairs 25
youth grows pale unk thin dies
think full unk
unk eyed unk
beauty cannot keep lustrous eyes
new love pine beyond unk 30
away away fly thee
unk unk unk
unk wings poesy
though dull brain unk unk
already thee tender night 35
unk queen moon throne
unk around unk unk
light
save heaven breezes blown
unk unk winding unk ways 40
cannot see flowers feet
soft incense hangs upon unk
unk darkness guess sweet
unk unk month unk
grass thicket fruit tree wild 45
white hawthorn pastoral unk
fast fading unk cover leaves
mid may eldest child
coming unk rose full unk wine
unk haunt flies summer unk 50
unk listen many time
half love unk death
call soft names many unk rhyme
take air quiet breath
ever seems rich die 55
cease upon midnight pain
thou art pouring forth thy soul abroad
ecstasy
still unk thou sing ears vain
thy high unk become sod 60
unk unk born death immortal bird
hungry generations unk thee
voice hear passing night heard
ancient days emperor clown
perhaps self song found path 65
sad heart ruth sick home
stood tears amid alien corn
unk hath
unk magic unk opening unk
perilous seas unk lands forlorn 70
unk word like bell
toll back thee sole self
unk fancy cannot unk well
famed unk elf
unk unk thy plaintive anthem fades 75
past near meadows still stream
hill side tis buried deep
next valley unk
vision waking dream
unk music wake sleep 80

hms marlborough 1912
hms marlborough iron duke class battleship british royal navy named honour john churchill 1st duke marlborough built devonport royal dockyard january 1912 june 1914 entering service outbreak first world war armed main battery ten 13 5 inch 340 mm guns capable top speed 21 25 knots 39 36 km h 24 45 mph
marlborough served grand fleet duration war primarily patrolling northern end north sea enforce blockade germany saw action battle jutland 31 may 1 june 1916 administered coup de unk badly damaged german cruiser sms wiesbaden engagement wiesbaden hit marlborough torpedo eventually forced withdraw damage marlborough repaired early august though last two years war uneventful british german fleets adopted cautious strategies due threat underwater weapons
war marlborough assigned mediterranean fleet took part allied intervention russian civil war black sea 1919 20 also involved greco turkish war 1930 london naval treaty mandated four iron duke class battleships discarded marlborough used variety weapons tests 1931 32 results incorporated reconstruction programme queen elizabeth class battleships
