service history
marlborough laid devonport royal dockyard 25 january 1912 launched nearly ten months later 24 october commissioned 2 june 1914 ship completed 16 june 1914 month first world war broke continent marlborough initially joined home fleets served flagship sir lewis unk following british entry war august home fleets reorganised grand fleet commanded admiral john jellicoe marlborough assigned flagship 1st battle squadron served duration conflict
first world war

protein
proteins unk unk large biomolecules macromolecules consisting one long chains amino acid residues proteins perform vast array functions within organisms including unk metabolic reactions dna replication responding unk transporting molecules one location another proteins differ one another primarily sequence amino acids dictated nucleotide sequence genes usually results protein folding specific three dimensional structure determines activity

aston villa one oldest successful football clubs history english football villa 1981 82 european cup thus one five english clubs win uefa champions league fifth highest total major honours english club first division championship seven times fa cup seven times football league cup five times european cup uefa super cup double 1982

history

rural roots
early life
harold adams innis born 1894 small livestock dairy farm near community otterville southwestern ontario oxford county boy loved rhythms routines farm life never unk rural origins mother mary adams innis named herald hoping would become minister strict evangelical baptist faith husband william shared time baptist church important part life rural areas gave isolated families sense community embodied values unk independence far flung congregations ruled centralized bureaucratic authority innis became agnostic later life never lost interest religion according friend biographer donald creighton innis character moulded church

hurricane lorenzo 2007
hurricane lorenzo rapidly developing tropical cyclone struck mexican state veracruz late september 2007 twelfth named storm fifth hurricane 2007 atlantic hurricane season formed southwestern gulf mexico tropical wave unk two days without development storm began steady westward track structure became better organized 18 hour period lorenzo winds increased 35 mph 55 km h 80 mph 130 km h tropical depression hurricane september 28 struck near tecolutla veracruz month hurricane dean affected area quickly dissipated land
significantly affected area veracruz damage reached 1 billion pesos 92 million 2007 usd came road damage state northern portion although also hundreds damaged houses veracruz neighboring hidalgo 123 320 people affected across 112 municipalities overall six deaths country one veracruz five puebla latter state family three perished landslide
meteorological history
origins hurricane lorenzo tropical wave exited coast africa september 11 moving across tropical atlantic ocean unk much caribbean sea developing area thunderstorms september 21 system developed low pressure area september 23 northern portion wave broke crossed yucatán peninsula initially hurricane hunters flight scheduled investigate system although low became disorganized southeastern gulf mexico due high wind shear however wind shear decreased late september 25 another hurricane hunters flight indicated development closed low level circulation based observation along sufficient persistence thunderstorms system developed tropical depression thirteen 190 mi 305 km east tampico tamaulipas
upon developing depression located area weak steering currents resulting erratic movement generally south formative stages depression executed small loop moved area warm waters decreasing wind shear depression convection gradually organized although winds slower increase anticyclone became established system depression intensified tropical storm lorenzo around 1200 utc september 27 time located 150 mi 240 km east tuxpan veracruz moving steadily westward influence building ridge east approached coast lorenzo rapidly intensified unexpectedly within 12 hours attaining tropical storm status strengthened hurricane
hurricane lorenzo quickly developed closed eyewall observed radar provided peak intensity estimate 80 mph 130 km h 0000 utc september 28 cyclone maintained vigorous unk convection across center although structure deteriorated slightly lorenzo crossed coast near tecolutla veracruz unk utc day winds estimated around 75 mph 120 km h making landfall hurricane rapidly weakened tropical depression intensity unk inland circulation became difficult locate convection diminished rainbands along coast within 19 hours moving ashore circulation lorenzo dissipated therefore ending duration tropical cyclone

first battle maryang san
first battle maryang san 3 8 october 1951 also known defensive battle unk chinese unk pinyin unk unk unk unk fought korean war united nations un forces primarily australian british chinese communist people volunteer army fighting occurred limited un offensive us corps codenamed operation commando offensive ultimately pushed chinese back imjin river jamestown line destroyed elements four chinese armies following heavy fighting much smaller battle maryang san took place five day period saw 3rd battalion royal australian regiment 3 rar unk numerically superior chinese force tactically important kowang san hill 355 maryang san hill 317 features conjunction units 1st commonwealth division
using tactics first developed japanese new guinea second world war australians gained advantage high ground assaulted chinese positions unexpected directions repelled repeated chinese counterattacks aimed capturing maryang san sides suffering heavy casualties australians finally relieved british battalion however peace talks ongoing operations proved last actions war manoeuvre lasted previous sixteen months replaced static war characterised fixed defences reminiscent western front 1915 17 month later chinese subsequently captured maryang san british fierce fighting never gained today battle widely regarded one australian army greatest accomplishments war

following general army douglas macarthur dismissal commander chief un forces korea replaced general matthew b ridgway consequently 14 april 1951 general james van fleet replaced ridgway commander us eighth army united nations forces korea chinese spring offensive april may 1951 ended defeat following two months sporadic operations mid june august war entered new phase van fleet returning offensive july kansas wyoming lines strengthened limited offensive east central sector mid august seized high ground around unk bloody ridge battle bloody ridge september offensive sector continued targeting next hill complex north bloody ridge known heartbreak ridge

battle
unk hill 199 3 october 1951
03 00 3 october b company 3 rar moved north 2 000 metres 2 200 yd toward hill 199 crossing open valley cover darkness heavy mist company moved behind c company artillery mortar fire targeted known chinese artillery positions counter battery fire prior dawn switching support borderers assault hill 355 simultaneously shropshires assaulting hill 208 support squadron 8th royal irish hussars reached positions without opposition 06 00 08 00 b company gained high ground north proceeded patrol short distance west objective taken three wounded five chinese killed one captured mid morning shropshires australians successfully captured objectives
unk counter attack australians hill 199 began digging however attack occurred company subsequently returned allocated position c company borderers c b companies received shelling day wounding two men 10 00 company captain jim shelton took defence hill 199 b company went reserve behind company according plan troop centurion tanks section medium machine guns moved onto hill 199 began directing fire onto northern slopes hill 355 support borderers meanwhile 07 15 following preparation artillery mortar fire lead british assault companies begun advance hill 355 however chinese expecting assault direction initial british moves met strong resistance borderers forced withdraw unk 14 15 second assault reached objectives lower slopes gains consolidated nightfall

fall maryang san 5 october 1951
final objective maryang san steep hill rising 200 metres 660 ft valley 2 500 metres 2 700 yd north hill 355 however following delay capturing hill 355 hassett would ready implement plan early next day third phase would begin 5 october royal northumberland fusiliers scheduled attack intermediate objective hill 217 adjacent kowang san assisting australians assault hill 317 australians moved position northeast hill 199 afternoon 4 october night 4 5 october divisional artillery hit chinese positions two batteries 8 inch 200 mm howitzers another two 155 millimetre 6 1 batteries unk air strikes mustangs 2 squadron south african air force also planned targeting chinese concentrations north west objectives cut supplies reinforcements australians fusiliers scheduled begin attacks first light 05 45 following heavy artillery preparation

hinge 6 8 october 1951

food album
food album compilation album american singer songwriter weird al yankovic released june 22 1993 scotti brothers records release features ten yankovic song parodies unk food similar album tv album features songs entirely television would released two years later
album begrudgingly released yankovic felt compilation unnecessary merely way record label make money several food related songs yankovic recorded girls want lunch waffle king left record although former due personal preference latter due scheduling issues
food album received mixed reviews music critics many felt record enjoyable collection songs essential record purchase despite lukewarm reception record certified gold recording industry association america riaa making yankovic first compilation record reach certification

leg wicket

development law
origins
earliest known written version laws cricket dating 1744 include lbw rule time batsmen english cricket used curved bats made unlikely would able stand directly front wickets however clause 1744 laws gave umpires power take action batsman standing unfair strike cricket bats modified become unk following years allowing batsmen stand closer wickets subsequently players deliberately began obstruct ball hitting wickets tactics criticised writers revision laws 1774 ruled batsman deliberately stopped ball hitting wicket leg however critics noted umpires left difficult task interpreting intentions batsmen 1788 version laws longer required umpires take account batsman intent batsman lbw stopped ball pitch ed straight clarification law came 1823 condition added ball must delivered straight line wicket ambiguity wording highlighted two prominent umpires disagreed whether ball travel straight line bowler wicket wickets either end pitch 1839 mcc responsible drafting laws cricket endorsed latter interpretation ruled batsman lbw ball pitched wickets would hit stumps

essence lbw law remained 1839 1937 despite several campaigns changed 1863 proposal allow batsman lbw ball hit body point wickets regardless ball pitched whether would hit wicket came nothing complaints proportion lbw dismissals county cricket began increase 1880s batsmen used pads protect legs use purposes considered unk amateur cricketers wear cricket became organised competitive batsmen began use pads second line defence lined ball missed bat ball struck pad instead wicket players took delivery easy one score runs attempted shot allowed ball bounce safely pads arthur shrewsbury first prominent player use methods others followed criticism practice heightened increased quality reliability cricket pitches made batting easier led higher scores created perceived imbalance game

zygoballus sexpunctatus
zygoballus sexpunctatus species jumping spider occurs southeastern united states found variety grassy habitats adult spiders measure 3 4 5 mm length cephalothorax abdomen bronze black color reddish brown yellowish legs male distinctive enlarged chelicerae unk used grasping prey front femora third typically largest leg segments like many jumping spiders z sexpunctatus males exhibit unk courtship agonistic behavior
etymology
specific name derived latin sex meaning six unk meaning spot reference six spots typically occurring abdomen male
history taxonomy
species first described unk nicholas unk hentz 1845 boston journal natural history hentz named species unk sexpunctatus described follows
black cephalothorax two posterior eyes near base wide suddenly inclined nearly right angle upper surface unk strong inner tooth long curved unk abdomen six dots line front white feet 1 4 2 3 first pair enlarged thighs quite long
hentz classified sexpunctatus unk group unk consisted jumping spiders whose first pair legs longest followed fourth pair later unk abandoned classification hentz admitted somewhat artificial 1888 recognition zygoballus independent genus american unk george elizabeth unk renamed spider zygoballus sexpunctatus specimens z sexpunctatus housed museum comparative unk british museum milwaukee public museum american museum natural history unk national unk unk type specimens known
genus zygoballus contains approximately twenty species distributed united states argentina zygoballus classified subfamily unk family unk jumping spiders
description
according unk b j unk adult females 3 5 4 5 mm body length males 3 3 5 mm peckhams earlier description however gives length 3 mm females 3 4 5 mm males
cephalothorax z sexpunctatus bronze black color like zygoballus spiders cephalothorax box like shape unk posterior lateral eyes numerous white pale blue scales cover unk face chelicerae covering extends around sides carapace ending beyond posterior median eyes males unk two unk long unk wide long chelicerae males greatly enlarged unk oriented unk prominent inner tooth long curved unk
legs reddish brown sometimes yellowish femora anterior first pair darker enlarged especially male anterior legs three pairs long spines ventral surface tibia two pairs spines unk peckhams give following measurements lengths legs male specimen starting anterior pair 3 7 mm 2 2 mm 2 mm 3 mm females fourth pair legs longest unk male single unk unk tapers gradually
abdomen bronze black white basal band two white transverse bands transverse bands often broken form six spots spots may lacking however
zygoballus sexpunctatus similar appearance zygoballus rufipes range overlaps male distinguished z rufipes large spot white scales beginning unk slope lacking z rufipes longitudinal division present bulb unk z rufipes transverse division female best distinguished form unk external genital structure
habitat distribution
range species extends new jersey florida west texas although commonly found southern states hentz collected original specimen north carolina 1909 peckhams reported species collected north carolina florida texas louisiana mississippi seven year survey spider species western mississippi reported abundance z sexpunctatus uncommon one year survey unk county florida reported species rare
specimens collected several ecosystems including old fields river terrace forests unk florida sand pine scrub slash pine forests appalachian grass unk rice fields robert betty barnes reported species occurring unk fields throughout southeastern unk species typically found herb unk among grasses short plants may collected sweep net
behavior
male zygoballus sexpunctatus spiders known exhibit elaborate courtship displays male approaches female typically raise spread first pair legs vibrate abdomen female receptive often vibrate abdomen well specific patterns courtship behavior however vary individuals
z sexpunctatus males exhibit unk agonistic behavior encountering males species behavior may include many elements courtship raising spreading first pair legs unk abdomen agonistic display males also extend unk fangs unk attacks males appear rare however

like spiders zygoballus sexpunctatus opportunistic unk feeding wide range invertebrate prey spider diet typically includes small insects unk young unk also known eat mosquitoes numerous kinds small spiders

unk missions
pioneer program 1973 1974
first spacecraft explore jupiter pioneer 10 flew past planet december 1973 followed pioneer 11 twelve months later pioneer 10 obtained first ever close images jupiter galilean moons spacecraft studied planet atmosphere detected magnetic field observed radiation belts determined jupiter mainly fluid pioneer 11 made closest approach within 34 000 km jupiter cloud tops december 4 1974 obtained dramatic images great red spot made first observation jupiter immense polar regions determined mass jupiter moon callisto information gathered two spacecraft helped astronomers engineers improve design future probes cope effectively environment around giant planet
voyager program 1979

royal prerogative united kingdom
royal prerogative body customary authority privilege immunity recognised united kingdom sole prerogative sovereign source many executive powers british government
prerogative powers formerly exercised monarch acting initiative since 19th century convention advice prime minister cabinet unk parliament decision required order prerogative exercised monarch remains unk empowered exercise royal prerogative advice prime minister cabinet practice would unk existing precedent adequately apply circumstances question
today royal prerogative available conduct government united kingdom including foreign affairs defence national security monarchy significant constitutional presence matters limited power exercise prerogative hands prime minister ministers government officials
definition
royal prerogative called notoriously difficult concept define adequately whether particular type prerogative power exists matter common law decided courts final unk prominent constitutional theorist v dicey proposed nineteenth century
prerogative appears historically matter fact nothing else residue discretionary arbitrary authority given time legally left hands crown prerogative name remaining portion crown original authority every act executive government unk without authority act parliament done virtue prerogative
many commentators follow unk view constitutional lawyers prefer definition given william blackstone unk

history

mount jackson antarctica
mount jackson mount andrew jackson mount ernest gruening mountain dominates upland southern part antarctic peninsula located palmer land within antarctic claims argentina chile united kingdom elevation 3 184 metres 10 446 ft mount jackson highest mountain antarctic peninsula british antarctic territory discovered members united states antarctic service 1939 41 named andrew jackson seventh president united states first ascent mount jackson made team led john unk cunningham british antarctic survey bas 1964 mount jackson geology studied 1972 part palmer island investigations team geologists
mount jackson welch mountains unk central black coast dissected many inlets bounded west unk plateau central palmer land two mountains rise ice shelf reliefs 1 200 1 500 metres 3 900 4 900 ft towards east interconnected unk zones forming plateau steep snow slopes mount jackson rises southeast flanks displaying steeple summit north flank occupied vast unk unk moraines mountain east side measure 1 5 kilometres 0 62 3 11 mi length display boulders distal ends
history
first topographic mapping mount jackson carried november 1940 unk party united states antarctic service unk ground survey facilitated aerial photographs aerial observations height estimated 4 200 metres 13 800 ft mountain named mount ernest gruening governor alaska territory time ernest gruening unk later renamed mount jackson seventh president united states president jackson signed bill law authorizing united states exploring expedition 1838 42 expedition led lt charles wilkes included exploration surveying pacific ocean surrounding lands including antarctica
november 1947 falkland islands dependencies survey unk ground party based unk island observed mount jackson estimated height 3 050 metres 10 010 ft considerably lower accurate first estimate 1940
falkland islands dependencies survey renamed british antarctic survey 1962 series depots developed including one mount jackson bas members successful making many first unk mountains antarctic peninsula john cunningham served bas base adelaide island first climb mount jackson traveling dog unk 640 kilometres 400 mi team reached summit 23 november 1964
precise height summit determined bas survey party ascended peak unk summer 1996 97

italian cruiser aretusa
aretusa torpedo cruiser unk class built italian regia marina royal navy 1880s unk june 1889 unk unk unk orlando shipyard launched march 1891 commissioned september 1892 main armament six torpedo tubes supported battery ten small caliber guns aretusa spent career main italian fleet primarily occupied training exercises start italo turkish war september 1911 assigned red sea squadron italian eritrea bombarded ottoman positions arabian peninsula took part blockade coast unk end war october 1912 aretusa sold scrap december broken
design

history study
first ceratopsian remains known science discovered us geological geographical survey territories led american geologist unk unk unk discovered 1855 expedition montana first assigned hadrosaurids included within genus trachodon early 20th century recognized ceratopsian teeth another unk expeditions 1872 fielding bradford unk found several giant bones protruding hillside southwestern wyoming alerted paleontologist edward unk cope led dig recover partial skeleton cope recognized remains dinosaur noted even though fossil lacked skull different type dinosaur known named new species agathaumas unk meaning marvellous forest dweller soon cope named two dinosaurs would eventually come recognized ceratopsids unk monoclonius monoclonius notable number unk remains found including first evidence ceratopsid horns frills several monoclonius fossils found cope assisted charles unk sternberg summer 1876 near judith river unk county montana since ceratopsians recognised yet distinctive group cope uncertain much fossil material recognizing nasal horn core brow horns part fossil horn frill bone interpreted part unk

classification
ceratopsia coined othniel charles marsh 1890 include dinosaurs possessing certain characteristic features including horns rostral bone teeth two roots fused neck vertebrae forward oriented unk marsh considered group distinct enough warrant suborder within unk name derived greek unk unk meaning horn unk unk meaning face early 1960s noted name ceratopsia actually incorrect linguistically unk however spelling technically correct used rarely scientific literature vast majority paleontologists continue use ceratopsia unk govern taxa level superfamily unlikely change

hope highway
hope highway also known hope road unk forest highway located kenai peninsula borough us state alaska highway connects city hope seward highway travels 17 miles 27 km chugach national forest road passes ghost town sunrise city several smaller settlements remnants gold rush occurred area highway created circa 1928 designated forest highway 14 federal highway administration
route description
hope highway begins intersection seward highway ak 1 inside chugach national forest highway proceeds north traveling several miles pine forest valley kenai mountain range highway passes alongside resurrection creek source settlement area road proceeds abandoned settlement sunrise city old mining town roadway proceeds unk arm turns westward direction road continues along arm several miles entering city hope highway passes hope intersecting old hope highway several smaller streets exiting town unk forest highway reaches northern terminus access road unk creek unk entire length hope highway located chugach national forest portion highway listed national highway system
traffic
traffic hope highway low highest traffic count 400 vehicles daily intersection seward highway daily average vehicle count highway 300
history
hope highway first established 1928 original highway connected city hope moose pass took people unk via alaska railroad seward highway completed 1951 allowed travelers get hope without transport vehicle train highway operated improved dirt road 1952 1953 highway finally paved portion highway connected hope campgrounds created 1970s around time extension route hope highway rerouted around city hope original path traveled city renamed old hope highway 1982 expansion federal forest highway system hope highway added system due location local importance
major junctions

old hope highway
old hope highway short historic route hope highway located city hope road 0 259 miles 0 unk km long connects hope highway central region hope road unpaved gravel surface passes several small businesses homes located hope road part original hope highway created 1928 remained part highway circa 1970 highway rerouted around hope

etymology
english common name fieldfare dates back least eleventh century anglo saxon word unk perhaps meant traveller fields
species described linnaeus systema unk 1758 current scientific name name turdus unk comes two separate latin words thrush subspecies recognised

tommy lawton
thomas tommy lawton 6 october 1919 6 november 1996 english football player manager strong centre forward excellent round attacking skills able head ball tremendous power accuracy despite losing much best years world war ii scored 260 goals unk league cup competitions 14 full seasons football league
born unk raised bolton played amateur football unk united turned professional burnley 17th birthday also played cricket burnley cricket club potential footballer 6 500 move everton january 1937 went finish first division top scorer 1937 38 1938 39 helping everton finish champions football league latter campaign league football suspended seven full seasons due outbreak war europe time scored 24 goals 23 appearances england whilst unk everton number clubs november 1945 moved chelsea 14 000 scored club record 26 goals 34 league games 1946 47 season

style play

history
background
georges unk best known pen name hergé employed editor illustrator le petit vingtième little twentieth children supplement le vingtième siècle twentieth century unk roman catholic conservative belgian newspaper based hergé native brussels run unk norbert wallez paper described catholic newspaper doctrine information disseminated far right fascist viewpoint according harry thompson political ideas common belgium time hergé milieu permeated conservative ideas revolving around patriotism catholicism strict morality discipline unk
1929 hergé began adventures tintin comic strip le petit vingtième series exploits fictional belgian reporter named tintin following success tintin land soviets serialised weekly le petit vingtième january 1929 may 1930 hergé wanted send tintin united states wallez insisted write story set belgian congo belgian colony today democratic republic congo belgian children learned congo school wallez hoped encourage unk missionary zeal readership believed belgian colonial administration needed promotion time memories still fairly fresh 1928 visit colony belgian king albert queen elisabeth also hoped readers would inspired work congo

andrew johnston singer
andrew johnston born 23 september 1994 british singer rose fame appeared boy soprano second series uk television talent show britain got talent 2008 although win competition received contract record syco music label owned britain got talent judge simon cowell johnston debut album one voice released september year reached number four uk albums chart although johnston originally performed treble voice since matured baritone member national youth choir
johnston born unk scotland parents separated infant mother moved carlisle lived poverty became head chorister carlisle cathedral bullied school love classical music journalists argued britain got talent producers took advantage johnston background others hailed story inspirational 2009 graduated trinity school johnston studies full time royal northern college music
history
early life carlisle cathedral choir

mycena galericulata

gertrude barrows bennett
gertrude barrows bennett 1883 1948 first major female writer fantasy science fiction united states publishing stories pseudonym francis stevens bennett wrote number highly acclaimed fantasies 1917 1923 called woman invented dark fantasy
famous books include claimed augustus swift letter argosy called one unk compelling science fantasy novels ever read lost world novel citadel fear
bennett also wrote early dystopian novel heads cerberus 1919
life
gertrude unk barrows born minneapolis 1883 completed school eighth grade attended night school hopes becoming illustrator goal never achieved instead began working stenographer job held rest life
1909 barrows married stewart bennett british journalist explorer moved philadelphia year later husband died expedition new born daughter raise bennett continued working stenographer father died toward end world war bennett assumed care invalid mother
time period bennett began write number short stories novels stopping mother died 1920 mid 1920s moved california bennett estranged daughter number years researchers believed bennett died 1939 date final letter daughter however new research including death certificate shows died 1948
writing career
bennett wrote first short story age 17 science fiction story titled curious experience thomas dunbar unk story argosy one top pulp magazines story accepted published march 1904 issue

johnny mcnichol
john johnny mcnichol 20 august 1925 17 march 2007 scottish footballer played 500 games football league england inside forward played 150 games brighton hove albion 200 chelsea crystal palace
mcnichol graduated junior footballer apprentice motor mechanic native scotland professional contract english first division club newcastle united two years found success reserve team never selected first eleven brighton hove albion struggling third division broke transfer record sign mcnichol spent four years club acquiring reputation finest inside forward third division moving first division chelsea manager ted drake first signing part chelsea team league championship 1954 55 season 1958 joined crystal palace captained promotion fourth division finished field career southern league player manager unk wells rangers spent 25 years working commercial side football two previous clubs

otra nota
otra nota english another note debut album american singer marc anthony released january 26 1993 rmm records produced sergio george first album anthony record salsa starting career freestyle musician recording album began anthony asked rmm president ralph mercado record juan gabriel hasta que te conocí salsa hearing radio taxi ride recorded low budget album peaked 2 billboard tropical albums chart reached 30 billboard top latin albums chart
album well received critics complimented george production anthony youthful voice anthony received two awards best new artists billboard latin music awards lo unk awards album produced three singles hasta que te conocí palabras del alma si tú te fueras charted billboard hot latin songs chart 2002 otra nota sold 300 000 copies

rocky mountain horse
rocky mountain horse horse breed developed state kentucky united states despite name originated rocky mountains instead appalachian mountains foundation stallion brought western united states eastern kentucky around 1890 began rocky mountain type late 19th century mid 20th century stallion named old tobe owned prominent breeder used develop modern type today rocky mountain horses trace back stallion 1986 rocky mountain horse association formed 2005 registered 12 000 horses breed known preferred chocolate coat color flaxen mane tail result relatively rare silver dapple gene acting black coat seen much population also exhibits four beat ambling gait known single foot originally developed multi purpose riding driving light draft horse today used mainly trail riding working cattle
unk characteristics

ontario highway 36
king highway 36 commonly referred highway 36 unk maintained highway canadian province ontario highway connected highway 7 highway 35 lindsay highway 28 burleigh falls providing access recreational cottages along northern shore several kawartha lakes well multiple communities including bobcaygeon today known kawartha lakes city road 36 peterborough county road 36
route first assumed 1931 depression relief project extended 1937 remained generally unchanged next 60 years decommissioned 1998 however realignment near lindsay late 1950s changed southern terminus route centre town southeast original route lindsay became highway unk known kawartha lakes road 17
route description
route surroundings former highway 36 largely remained unaltered since highway decommissioned 1998 within city kawartha lakes road known kawartha lakes road 36 within county peterborough known peterborough county road 36
route begins east lindsay intersection highway 7 progresses north crossing former railway kawartha rail trail intersecting kawartha lakes road 17 western leg road 17 travels downtown lindsay original route highway 36 later became highway unk continuing north highway 36 unk north east serving cottages communities lining southern shore sturgeon lake remains inland kilometre 0 6 mi unk bypassed highway intersects kawartha lakes roads 7 24 former travels south unk latter provides alternative route bobcaygeon former highway 36 continues alternating directions east north twice entering village bobcaygeon
within bobcaygeon highway 36 crosses trent severn waterway intersects eastern end kawartha lakes road 8 point following southernmost section bobcaygeon colonization road intersection main street northern end village route turns northeast former highway 649 continues north
unk bobcaygeon former highway serves cottages along northern shore unk lake little bald lake passing unk creek highway descends hill encounters canadian shield first time road runs along border unk shield ordovician limestone plateau en route burleigh falls shield lies north unk plateau south highway turns south unk corner intersecting former highway unk enters town buckhorn north drivers must turn remain route exits town east buckhorn burleigh falls highway serves cottages line northern shore lower buckhorn lake
history
highway 36 first assumed department highways unk july 1 1931 one several highways completed part depression relief program highway initially connected downtown lindsay bobcaygeon section fully paved end 1937 august 11 1937 unk extended highway east highway 28 burleigh falls
highway 36 remained essentially unchanged 1937 1997 exception rerouted east lindsay 1958 however january 1 1998 entirety highway 36 downloaded victoria county peterborough county redesignated county road 36 victoria county became city kawartha lakes 2001 section route known city road 36

oldham

grant maintained status academy conversion
1979 general election brought conservative government power allowed council shift focus towards retaining grammar schools still existed improving schools work put hold comprehensive debate despite 90 english councils adopting comprehensive education lincolnshire retained grammar schools although county council began discussing abolition 1985 opposition parents public consultation 1987 resulted plans dropped question future resolved carre applied grant maintained status 1989 education secretary approved proposals formally granted status september 1990 grant maintained status abolished 1999 carre became foundation school following successful bid unk submitted october 2002 school granted specialist sports college status 2003 weather pitch laid 2007 new technology building fitness suite opened 2011 2009 carre became specialist science college lead school gifted talented students school converted academy status august 2011 2014 governors announced intention bid conversion multi academy trust become coeducational selective school new site february 2015 kesteven sleaford high school announced intention join proposed trust moved welcomed carre carre officially became part robert carre multi academy trust 1 september 2015 schools continue operate sites sharing staff facilities

severe tropical storm domoina 1984 caused 100 year floods south africa record rainfall swaziland fourth named storm season domoina developed january 16 northeast coast madagascar ridge north storm tracked generally westward later southwestward january 21 domoina struck eastern madagascar third storm six weeks affect nation collectively storms caused 42 deaths 25 million damage 1984 usd crossing country domoina strengthened mozambique channel peak 10 minute sustained winds 95 km h 60 mph january 28 storm made landfall southern mozambique slowly weakened land domoina crossed swaziland later eastern south africa dissipating february 2

crossing madagascar westward trajectory domonia weakened jtwc estimated winds decreased 55 km h 35 mph earlier estimating winds 95 km h 60 mph landfall january 23 storm emerged mozambique channel near belo due ridge north resumed southwest motion domoina executed two small loops western coast madagascar progressing generally southwestward january 25 mfr estimated domonia attained peak 10 minute sustained winds 95 km h 60 mph near europa island made severe tropical storm two days later jtwc estimated peak 10 minute winds 100 km h 65 mph early january 28 domonia made second landfall southeastern mozambique near peak intensity slowly weakened land moving across southern mozambique jtwc discontinued advisories january 29 storm near border mozambique swaziland next day domonia crossed swaziland subsequently eastern south africa weakening tropical depression passing near durban around time system dissipating although mfr continued tracking domonia february 2 dissipated offshore east coast south africa

new jersey route 65
route 65 former state highway city newark new jersey route went 4 12 miles 6 63 km along port street doremus avenue industrial districts city route 65 began intersection us route 1 9 near newark liberty international airport route crossed new jersey turnpike along port street intersection doremus avenue turned northward rest distance terminating intersection us route 1 9 truck
route 65 originally planned 1939 spur route 25 route 25b newark connect route route unk us route 1 9 truck route lasted 14 years january 1 1953 1953 new jersey state highway renumbering occurred route 25b decommissioned day along parent route route 25 route 25b redesigned route 65 removed state highway system 1963 two roads maintained city newark
route description
route 65 began intersection us route 1 9 area newark liberty international airport city newark route progressed eastward along port street divided highway short distance route crossed access road airport crossing newly constructed new jersey turnpike south interchange 14 route 65 continued port street one roadway industrial districts newark route progressed railroad intersecting doremus avenue route 65 turned northward port street port street doremus avenue dead end right respective intersection doremus avenue south port street east
route 65 headed northward along doremus avenue crossing newark bay unk interstate 78 north intersection route continued industrial district reaching higher elevation bridge central railroad new jersey unk unk unk operations unk route paralleled turnpike mainline along doremus avenue intersection raymond boulevard route 65 became divided highway terminating intersection us route 1 9 truck city newark
history
route 65 originally designated 1939 state highway route 25b spur state highway route 25 us route 1 9 traffic circle near newark metropolitan airport newark liberty international airport route commence along port street doremus avenue intersection state highway route unk us route 1 9 truck route 25b remained intact along alignment port street doremus avenue january 1 1953 day new jersey state highway department renumbered routes state eliminated route 25 entirely due decommissioning route 25 route 25b renumbered route 65 eliminating relation former route 25 us route 1 9 route 65 remained port street doremus avenue alignment short time completely eliminated state system 1963 port street doremus avenue maintained city newark national highway system 2009 2001 bridge unk line reconstructed

giacomo meyerbeer
giacomo meyerbeer born jacob liebmann beer 5 september 1791 2 may 1864 german opera composer jewish birth described perhaps successful stage composer nineteenth century 1831 opera robert le diable successors gave genre grand opera decisive character meyerbeer grand opera style achieved merging german orchestra style italian vocal tradition employed context sensational melodramatic libretti created eugène scribe enhanced date theatre technology paris opéra set standard helped maintain paris opera capital nineteenth century
born wealthy berlin family meyerbeer began musical career pianist soon decided devote opera spending several years italy studying composing 1824 opera il crociato egitto first bring europe wide reputation robert le diable 1831 raised status great celebrity public career lasting death remained dominating figure world opera summarized contemporary hector berlioz claimed luck talented talent lucky peak operas les huguenots 1836 le prophète 1849 last opera l africaine performed posthumously operas made frequently performed composer world leading opera houses nineteenth century
time successes paris meyerbeer prussian court kapellmeister director music 1832 1843 prussian general music director also influential opera berlin throughout germany early supporter richard wagner enabling first production latter opera rienzi commissioned write patriotic opera ein unk unk celebrate reopening berlin royal opera house 1844 wrote music certain prussian state occasions
apart around 50 songs meyerbeer wrote little except stage critical assaults wagner supporters especially death led decline popularity works operas suppressed nazi regime germany neglected opera houses twentieth century meyerbeer works infrequently performed today

paris berlin
1832 1839
unk describes meyerbeer mature life tale two cities artistic triumph legendary status achieved paris never abandoned prussia especially home city berlin wife unk based berlin enjoy paris beloved mother series royal duties prussian court stemming appointment court kapellmeister 1832 reasons life 1830 onwards characterised travel two centres

route description
washington state route 221 sr 221 starts intersection sr 14 unincorporated community paterson leaving paterson highway travels north rural farm land two lane highway minor roads intersected roadway turns west 17 mi 27 km turning back north highway resumes northerly course climbs horse heaven hills gaining passing lane uphill segments finally terminating sr 22 south prosser

banksia violacea

oribi
oribi pronounced unk unk ourebi small antelope found eastern southern western africa sole member genus oribi first described german zoologist unk august wilhelm von zimmermann 1782 eight subspecies identified oribi reaches nearly 50 67 centimetres 20 26 shoulder weighs 12 22 kilograms 26 49 lb antelope features slightly raised back long neck limbs glossy yellowish rufous brown coat contrasts white chin throat underparts rump males possess horns thin straight horns 8 18 centimetres 3 1 7 1 long smooth tips ringed base
typically diurnal oribi active mainly day small herds four members common males defend group territory 25 100 hectares 62 247 acres large oribi primarily unk prefers fresh grasses unk occasionally seasonal breeder time mating occurs varies geographically unlike small antelopes oribi exhibit three types mating systems depending habitat unk polygyny unk gestation lasts six seven months following single calf born births peak november december southern africa unk takes place four five months
oribi occurs variety habitats unk floodplains tropical grasslands 10 100 centimetres 3 9 39 4 tall grasses unk grasslands low altitudes 2 000 metres 6 600 ft sea level antelope highly sporadic distribution ranging senegal west ethiopia eritrea east southward angola eastern cape south africa oribi classified least concern iucn numbers declined due agricultural expansion competition livestock

fire 1967
17 january 1967 9 pm fire caused electrical short circuit caused extensive damage cathedral altar forgiveness much structure decoration damaged including loss three paintings holy face alonso lópez de herrera martyrdom saint sebastian francisco de unk virgin forgiveness simon pereyns choir section lost 75 99 seats well painting juan correa along many stored books two cathedral organs severely damaged partial melting pipes unk rafael unk unk juan correa juan rodriguez juarez damaged parts cathedral fire authorities recorded damage nothing try restore damaged unk discussions ensued among historians architects investigations centering moving altar forgiveness well eliminating choir area unk 1972 ecclesiastical authorities initiated demolition choir area without authorization federal government stopped government unk could saved named jaime ortiz unk director project restore cathedral original condition restoration work focused repairing damage using archived records photographs also included work deteriorating foundation due uneven sinking ground problems towers

etymology wicca
modern english term wicca unk refers wicca religion contemporary pagan witchcraft used within pagan community competing definitions one refers entirety pagan witchcraft movement refers explicitly traditions included called british traditional wicca

bob dylan
bob dylan unk born robert allen zimmerman may 24 1941 american singer songwriter artist writer influential popular music culture five decades much celebrated work dates 1960s songs chronicled social unrest although dylan repudiated suggestions journalists spokesman generation nevertheless early songs blowin wind times unk became anthems american civil rights anti war movements left initial base american folk music revival six minute single like rolling stone altered range popular music 1965 mid 1960s recordings backed rock musicians reached top end united states music charts also attracting unk criticism others folk movement

stephanolepis cirrhifer

taxonomy

mogadishu
mogadishu unk somali unk arabic unk unk known locally hamar capital populous city somalia located coastal banaadir region indian ocean city served important port millennia 2015 population 2 120 000 residents
tradition old records assert southern somalia including mogadishu area historically inhabited hunter gatherers later joined cushitic unk unk would go establish local unk medieval golden age mogadishu ruled muzaffar dynasty vassal ajuran sultanate subsequently fell control assortment local unk polities notably geledi sultanate city later became capital italian somaliland 1889 1936 colonial period somali republic became independent 1960 mogadishu became known promoted white pearl indian ocean ousting siad barre regime 1991 ensuing civil war various militias fought control city later replaced islamic courts union mid 2000s icu thereafter splintered radical groups notably al shabaab fought transitional federal government 2004 2012 amisom allies change administration late 2010 government troops military partners succeeded forcing al shabaab august 2011 mogadishu subsequently experienced period intense reconstruction

transit venus
transit venus across sun takes place planet venus passes directly sun superior planet becoming visible hence obscuring small portion solar disk transit venus seen earth small black disk moving across face sun duration transits usually measured hours transit 2012 lasted 6 hours 40 minutes transit similar solar eclipse moon diameter venus 3 times moon venus appears smaller travels slowly across face sun much farther away earth

1955 atlantic hurricane season time costliest season ever recorded hurricane season officially began june 15 1955 ended november 15 1955 slightly average 13 recorded tropical cyclones first storm alice persisted since december 30 1954 alice caused relatively minor impact tracked lesser antilles eastern caribbean sea early january tropical storm brenda caused two deaths minor damage along gulf coast united states early august quick succession hurricanes connie diane caused significant flooding northeastern united states nearly 1 billion 1955 usd losses least 232 fatalities next three storms hurricanes edith flora tropical storm five caused minor impact early august hurricane gladys caused severe localized flooding mexico primarily mexico city additionally unk gladys inflicted minor impact texas
hurricane hilda struck greater antilles mexico attributed least unk deaths 120 million losses mid september hurricane ione struck eastern north carolina contributed flooding connie diane resulting seven fatalities 88 million damage later month hurricane janet peaked category 5 hurricane unk several countries adjacent caribbean sea well mexico british honduras janet resulted 53 8 million damage least 716 deaths unnamed tropical storm month october impact land hurricane katie final storm caused minor damage sparsely populated area hispaniola totaling least 200 000 7 fatalities also reported unk storms caused 1518 deaths 1 2 billion losses making costliest season time record number names four retired following season tied 1995 2004 surpassed 2005 five names retired
season summary
april 11 1955 prior start season gordon dunn promoted chief meteorologist miami hurricane warning office dunn replacing grady norton died stroke forecasting hurricane hazel previous season early june hurricane hunters received new reconnaissance aircraft contained latest radar electronic equipment time later month shortly start 1955 season bill proposed united states senate provide funding 55 new radar stations along east coast united states united states house representatives passed bill unk 5 million senate disputed possibly increasing funding two fold 10 million eventually unk installed starting july 1955 devastating storms season particularly connie diane united states government organization propose monitoring tropical cyclones established 1956 500 000 funding later became modern day national hurricane center
atlantic hurricane season officially began june 15 1955 average season 13 tropical cyclones formed typical season nine tropical storms develop five strengthen hurricane strength thirteen depressions attained tropical storm status eleven attained hurricane status six hurricanes intensified major hurricanes season average likely strong ongoing la unk hurricane alice developed late december 1954 persisted january 1955 operationally analysed developed latter within official hurricane season bounds tropical cyclogenesis occur july 31 development tropical storm brenda however month august four tropical cyclones formed including connie diane edith unnamed tropical storm five additional tropical cyclones flora gladys hilda ione janet developed september tropical cyclogenesis briefly halted unnamed tropical storm formed october 10 final storm season katie dissipated october 19 almost month official end hurricane season november 15 eight hurricanes two tropical storms made landfall season caused 1 603 deaths 1 1 billion damage
season activity reflected accumulated cyclone energy ace rating 199 1950 2000 average 96 1 ace broadly speaking measure power hurricane multiplied length time existed storms last long time well particularly strong hurricanes high unk calculated full advisories tropical cyclones winds exceeding 39 mph 63 km h tropical storm strength
storms
hurricane alice 1954
january 1 already tropical cyclone located central atlantic ocean developed december 30 previous year operationally first observed hurricane january 1 resulted named alice hurricane passed leeward islands january 2 alice reached peak winds 80 mph 130 km h encountering cold air turning southeast dissipated january 6 southeastern caribbean sea alice produced heavy rainfall moderately strong winds across several islands along path unk anguilla affected total damage amounting 623 500 operationally lack definitive data prevented us weather bureau declaring system hurricane january 2 received name alice early 1955 though analysis data supported extending track previous year resulting two tropical cyclones name one season one two storms span two calendar years along tropical storm unk 2005 2006
tropical storm brenda
tropical storm brenda developed north central gulf mexico 0600 utc july 31 next 24 hours storm strengthened rapidly attained maximum sustain wind speed 70 mph 110 km h early august 1 although possible briefly reached hurricane intensity later day brenda made landfall east new orleans louisiana intensity storm steadily weakened inland august 2 downgraded tropical depression early august 3 brenda dissipated located eastern texas
pensacola florida lake charles louisiana rainfall totals generally 4 inches 100 mm flooding insignificant tropical storm force winds reported peaking 50 mph 80 km h shell beach louisiana south shore lake unk location tides 5 6 feet 1 5 1 8 normal measured four people rescued united states coast guard tugboat sank lake unk three others swam shore additionally two fatalities occurred vicinity mobile alabama
hurricane connie
tropical wave developed tropical depression east cape verde august 3 six hours strengthened tropical storm connie august 4 connie began rapidly strengthen becoming first major hurricane season later day initially posed threat lesser antilles although passed 50 miles 80 km north outer rainbands produced hurricane force wind gusts intense precipitation reaching 8 65 inches 220 mm puerto rico united states virgin islands three people died due hurricane homes destroyed puerto rico connie destroyed 60 homes caused crop damage affecting puerto rico connie turned northwest reaching peak winds 140 mph 220 km h hurricane weakened slowing turning north struck north carolina august 12 category 2 hurricane
connie produced strong winds high tides heavy rainfall moved ashore causing heavy crop damage 27 deaths state north carolina connie made second landfall virginia progressed inland dissipating august 15 near unk unk marie michigan four people killed washington dc due traffic accident chesapeake bay connie capsized boat killing 14 people prompting change coast guard regulation six deaths pennsylvania new jersey eleven deaths new york record rainfall flooded homes unk least 225 000 people lost power storm damage united states totaled around 86 million although rains connie prelude flooding hurricane diane remnants connie destroyed houses boats ontario killed three people ontario
hurricane diane
tropical wave spawned tropical depression lesser antilles cape verde august 7 slowly strengthened became tropical storm diane august 9 unk interaction hurricane connie diane curved northward north northeastward quickly deepened early august 8 storm upgraded hurricane several hours later diane peaked category 2 hurricane winds 105 mph 165 km h storm resumed west northwestward motion august 13 unk air region caused diane weaken approaching east coast united states recently installed radar north carolina noted eye feature albeit poorly defined early august 17 diane made landfall near wilmington north carolina strong tropical storm storm moved unk motion across north carolina mid atlantic emerging atlantic ocean august 19 diane headed east northeastward becoming extratropical august 20
despite landfall north carolina impact state minor limited moderate rainfall abnormally high tides relatively strong winds north catastrophic flooding occurred pennsylvania new jersey new york new england unk stream gauges region 129 reported record levels flooding tropical storm diane many streams reported discharge rates twice previous record flooding occurred along small river basins rapidly rose within hours flood stage largely occurring populated areas region floods occurred 30 million people unk houses overall destroyed floods severely damaged homes highways power lines railroads affected several summer camps overall utility damage estimated 79 million flooding mountainous areas caused landslides destroyed crop fields agriculture losses estimated 7 million hundreds miles roads bridges also destroyed accounting 82 million damage overall diane caused 754 7 million damage 600 million new england overall least 184 deaths
hurricane edith
easterly tropical wave developed tropical depression august 21 tropical atlantic moving towards west northwest disturbance slowly intensified reaching tropical storm strength 1200 utc august 23 named edith weather bureau afterwards edith began curve towards northwest gradually intensified attaining hurricane strength august 25 hurricane continued intensify recurved accelerated northeast reaching peak intensity august 28 category 2 hurricane maximum sustained winds 100 mph 160 km h time reconnaissance aircraft reported minimum barometric pressure 991 mbar hpa 29 27 inhg storm eye edith made closest pass bermuda hurricane began gradually weaken passed east island becoming extratropical august 31 cyclone would later make clockwise loop dissipating completely late september 3 although edith remained sea suspected hurricane may caused loss pleasure yacht unk iv separated unk
tropical storm five
weak disturbance first observed near grand cayman august 23 gaining tropical storm strength 0600 utc day moving towards north northwest storm passed western cuba august 24 without much change intensity gulf mexico tropical storm marginally intensified reaching peak intensity maximum sustained wind speeds 45 mph 75 km h 1200 utc august 26 unk gulf coast united states system curved towards west storm maintained intensity landfall louisiana near new orleans august 27 moving inland slowly weakened crossing central united states degenerating tropical depression strength august 29 later dissipating missouri following day

hurricane flora
tropical wave moved along intertropical convergence zone itcz passed cape verde august 30 august 31 although unk unk headquarters unk brazil reported closed circulation august 30 tropical storm flora develop 0600 utc september 2 located 400 miles 640 km cape verde storm strengthened steady pace following 48 hours reached hurricane status late september 3 flora headed unk track initially moving west northwestward northwesterly september 4 continued intensify september 6 storm curved northward around time minimum barometric pressure unk mbar 28 6 inhg reported however may lower storm attain maximum sustained wind speed 105 mph 165 km h september 7 flora maintained intensity curving northeast became extratropical 0000 utc september 9 located midway flores island azores unk island nova scotia
hurricane gladys
tropical depression developed southern gulf mexico 1200 utc september 4 six hours later strengthened tropical storm gladys storm quickly intensified reached hurricane status september 5 roughly 24 hours developing around time gladys peaked category 1 hurricane maximum sustained winds 75 mph 120 km h later september 5 unk gladys cyclonic turning formed northern gulf mexico struck texas september 6 may separate tropical cyclone initially gladys headed north northwestward curved south southwestward approaching gulf coast mexico early september 6 made landfall near tampico tamaulipas weakening tropical storm system rapidly dissipated inland
gladys dropped 25 inches 640 mm tampico tamaulipas worst flooding gladys occurred mexico city roughly 5 000 residents isolated required rescue police estimated 2 300 homes inundated 5 7 feet 1 5 2 1 water 30 000 families impacted storm two children drowned five additional people listed missing texas highest sustained wind speed 45 mph 75 km h corpus christi port connor area gusts 55 65 mph 89 105 km h offshore precipitation peaked 17 02 inches 432 mm unk bluff neighborhood corpus christi flooding area forced scores people evacuate homes damage estimates reached 500 000
hurricane ione
tropical wave developed tropical depression early september 10 located midway cape verde lesser antilles six hours depression strengthened tropical storm ione eventually turned northwest 0000 utc september 15 ione reached hurricane intensity situated north leeward islands ione continued deep moving northwest storm reached category 4 intensity maximum sustained winds 140 mph 220 km h minimum barometric pressure 938 mbar 27 7 inhg early september 18 around midday following day made landfall near wilmington north carolina category 2 hurricane shortly moving inland eastern north carolina ione weakened tropical storm late september 19 ione emerged atlantic near norfolk virginia storm quickly strengthened early september 20 transitioned extratropical cyclone september 21

hurricane hilda
tropical wave located near lesser antilles spawned tropical depression september 12 estimated depression strengthened tropical storm hilda early following day hilda quickly intensified moving westward small hurricane september 12 although storm passed north hispaniola september 13 damage unknown later day hilda made landfall near southeastern tip cuba september 13 dropped heavy rainfall produced gusty winds destroyed 80 coffee crop oriente province eastern cuban city unk hilda severely damaged oldest church country damage totaled 2 million cuba four deaths

hurricane janet
hurricane janet powerful tropical cyclone season one strongest atlantic hurricanes record hurricane formed tropical wave east lesser antilles september 21 moving toward west across caribbean sea janet fluctuated intensity generally strengthened reaching peak intensity category 5 hurricane saffir simpson hurricane scale winds 175 mph 280 km h intense hurricane made landfall intensity near unk mexico september 28 janet landfall category 5 hurricane yucatán peninsula marked first recorded instance storm intensity atlantic basin made continental mainland previous storms making landfall category 5 hurricanes islands weakening yucatán peninsula moved bay campeche slightly strengthened making final landfall near veracruz september 29 janet quickly weakened mexico mountainous terrain dissipating september 30
developmental stages near lesser antilles janet caused significant damage island chain resulting 189 deaths 7 8 million damages unk barbados janet central caribbean sea reconnaissance aircraft flew storm lost eleven crew members believed perished loss occurred association atlantic hurricane category 5 upon landfall yucatán peninsula janet caused severe devastation areas unk roo british honduras five buildings unk mexico remained intact storm estimated 500 deaths occurred mexican state unk roo janet second landfall near veracruz significant river flooding ensued worsening effects caused hurricanes gladys hilda earlier month floods left thousands people stranded killed least 326 people tampico area flood damage would lead largest mexican relief operation ever executed united states least 1 unk deaths attributed hurricane janet well 65 8 million damages
tropical storm eleven
tropical wave moved coast africa september 18 continued west northwestward possible system developed tropical depression next day although lack data prevented classification september 23 nearby ship reported winds 35 mph 55 km h approaching cold front turned system north september 24 structure gradually became better organized turning northeast september 26 depression intensified tropical storm based ship report 45 mph 75 km h winds also estimated system peak intensity september 27 system became extratropical accelerated forward motion dissipating within larger extratropical storm south iceland next day

hurricane katie
disturbance itcz developed tropical depression north panama october 14 early following day depression strengthened tropical storm katie system moved generally northeast due presence strong low pressure area along east coast united states later day hurricane hunters observed rapidly intensifying hurricane encountering winds 110 mph 175 km h pressure unk mbar 29 1 inhg several hours peak intensity early october 17 katie made landfall extreme eastern unk unk department haiti strong category 2 hurricane although may stronger half homes town unk à unk destroyed across border unk dominican republic 68 houses damaged overall losses least 200 000 7 fatalities reported
crossing mountainous terrain hispaniola katie became disorganized rapidly weakened tropical storm early october 17 within hours moving inland later day storm emerged atlantic ocean east puerto plata dominican republic katie began accelerating northeast october 18 time storm intensified briefly approached hurricane intensity although failed strengthen due interaction cold front passing east bermuda october 19 storm transitioned extratropical cyclone remnants katie last observed following day

stuart mccall
andrew stuart murray mccall born 10 june 1964 usually known stuart mccall football manager former player current manager bradford city made total 763 league games 40 full international matches scotland playing career
mccall started professional career bradford city made senior debut 1982 played six seasons valley parade time division three championship title overshadowed bradford city stadium fire 56 people died father andy injured missing promotion 1987 88 mccall moved everton scored twice finished losing side 1989 fa cup final 1991 moved rangers spent seven seasons six league titles three scottish cups two scottish league cups mccall returned bradford city captain take top division english football first time 77 years four seasons moved sheffield united retired player 2005
born raised england mccall qualified play scotland scottish father 40 international caps scored one goal 1990 fifa world cup italy also played two european championships international career ended left 1998 world cup squad
mccall part coaching staff second spell bradford city briefly serving caretaker player manager 2000 continued coaching sheffield united assistant manager neil warnock may 2007 returned bradford city third time time manager spent two half seasons charge bradford city leaving february 2010 end 2010 appointed motherwell manager stayed fir park four years helping club finish second league twice poor start 2014 15 season resigned november 2014 mccall appointed manager rangers march 2015 left club end short term contract
early personal life

rangers

back bradford city

sheffield united
2 july 2002 mccall joined sheffield united played integral part first team side despite 38 also coached reserves league title played 71 league games next two seasons scored twice including winner former side bradford side reached division one play final 2003 well semi finals cup competitions year however dean windass also sheffield united left play final united lost 3 0 wolverhampton wanderers mccall played two league cup games 2004 05 season retired weeks 41st birthday career total 763 league games placed 13th position time appearance list british footballers

aftermath

romani first decisive victory attained british land forces changed whole face campaign theatre unk enemy initiative never obtained also made clearing troops egyptian territory feasible proposition
series successful british infantry mounted operations resulted complete defeat 16 000 18 000 strong german austrian ottoman force half killed wounded nearly 4 000 taken prisoner also captured mountain gun battery four heavy guns nine machine guns complete camel pack machine gun company 2 300 rifles million rounds ammunition two complete field hospitals instruments fittings drugs great quantity stores supply depot bir el abd destroyed captured arms equipment made germany camel pack machine gun company equipment especially designed desert warfare many rifles latest pattern made unk steel murray estimated total german ottoman casualties 9 000 german estimate put loss one third force 5 500 6 000 seems low considering number prisoners

baltimore mayoral election 1999
november 2 1999 city baltimore maryland elected new mayor 47th city history primary elections held determine nominees democratic party republican party september 14 unk mayor kurt schmoke democrat opted run reelection martin malley member baltimore city council election succeed schmoke
baltimore electorate overwhelmingly democratic whoever democratic primary election seen favorite republican nominee general election baltimore large african american population initially made seem likely next mayor would also african american unk mfume preferred candidate local politicians opted run though carl stokes lawrence bell members city council declared race local leaders unk quality declared candidates
1999 baltimore experienced high rates murder unemployment failing city school system malley declared candidacy focusing campaign zero tolerance approach crime received endorsements many city african american leaders close race malley overtook stokes bell win democratic nomination assured victory general election defeated republican candidate david f tufaro general election overwhelming majority

hurricane ingrid
hurricane ingrid one two tropical cyclones along hurricane manuel strike mexico within 24 hour period first occurrence since 1958 ingrid ninth named storm second hurricane 2013 atlantic hurricane season formed september 12 gulf mexico broad disturbance also spawned manuel eastern pacific initially moving westward toward veracruz ingrid turned northeastward away coast unk conditions allowed attain hurricane status september 14 next day ingrid attained peak winds 140 km h 85 mph subsequently increased wind shear weakened convection storm turned northwest west september 16 ingrid made landfall south la pesca tamaulipas northeastern mexico strong tropical storm dissipated next day
combined impacts hurricanes ingrid manuel affected two thirds mexico killing 192 people causing 75 billion pesos mxn 5 7 billion usd damage effects due manuel though ingrid directly responsible least 32 deaths 20 billion pesos mxn 1 5 billion usd damage two storms produced 162 billion m3 5 7 trillion cu ft water equivalent filling every dam mexico rainfall storm peaked 511 mm 20 1 tuxpan veracruz rains caused widespread flooding damaging least 14 000 houses hundreds roads bridges tamaulipas storm made landfall rainfall damaged crops flooded rivers effects storm spread southern texas causing high tides flooding storm mexican government declared several municipalities states emergency relief agencies distributed food aid hardest hit areas although tamaulipas residents rely assistance local gulf unk names ingrid manuel later retired due impacts
meteorological history
august 28 tropical wave exited west coast africa moved westward across atlantic ocean without development september 2 area convection thunderstorms developed along northern portion wave eventually absorbed tropical storm gabrielle north puerto rico wave continued westward caribbean sea large area cyclonic flow surface extended across central america eastern pacific around september 9 broad system developed two areas disturbed weather one eastern pacific would become hurricane manuel developing northwestern caribbean latter system slowly organized developing low pressure area september 11 subsequently system moved yucatán peninsula although land interaction prevented immediate development conditions favored development bay campeche early september 12 low emerged bay 1800 utc national hurricane center nhc assessed tropical depression ten developed 280 km 170 mi east northeast veracruz confirmed hurricane hunters flight indicating presence closed low level circulation
september 13 convection organization increased depression strengthened tropical storm ingrid weak steering currents resulted little movement cyclone unk due presence nearby hurricane manuel eastern pacific basin side mexico significant wind shear existed vicinity ingrid nonetheless strong convection intermittent development eye allowed strengthening storm september 14 ingrid strengthened hurricane second season afternoon around time hurricane turned sharply northeastward due trough eastern mexico ridge southeastern united states additional strengthening took place thereafter ingrid reached peak intensity 140 km h 85 mph early september 15 starting move northward begin northwest turn towards mexican coastline
afterward ingrid reached peak winds shear increased began weaken hurricane approached mexican coast center became displaced edge convection nhc forecaster daniel brown noted ingrid resemble classic hurricane satellite pictures around 1115 utc september 16 ingrid made landfall south la pesca tamaulipas northeastern mexico weakened strong tropical storm 100 km h 65 mph winds near landfall hurricane hunters reported flight level winds 120 km h 75 mph adjusting surface winds confirmed weakening storm moved ashore less 24 hours tropical storm manuel struck pacific coast mexico michoacán making first time since 1958 tropical cyclones struck coasts country within one day ingrid rapidly weakened tropical depression land although convection temporarily reorganized circulation dissipated september 17

typhoon imbudo
typhoon imbudo known philippines typhoon unk powerful typhoon struck philippines southern china july 2003 seventh named storm fourth typhoon season imbudo formed july 15 east philippines storm moved generally west northward much duration due ridge north unk conditions allowed imbudo intensify gradually first undergoing rapid deepening july 19 reaching typhoon status imbudo strengthened peak 10 minute sustained winds 165 km h 105 mph july 20 typhoon made landfall northern luzon near peak intensity july 22 quickly weakened land south china sea imbudo intensified slightly making final landfall southern china near yangjiang july 24 dissipating next day
philippines imbudo strongest typhoon five years causing widespread flooding power outages cagayan valley weeks damage heaviest isabela province near storm struck banana crop destroyed crops sustained similar lesser damage imbudo disrupted transportation across much luzon nationwide storm damaged destroyed 62 314 houses causing unk billion php 86 million usd damage mostly cagayan valley also 64 deaths country hong kong strong winds killed man knocking platform china damage heaviest guangdong storm struck thousands trees fell 595 000 houses wrecked hundreds canceled flights stranded travelers across region guangxi high rainfall increased water levels 45 reservoirs warning levels guangxi guangdong collectively 20 people killed damage reached 4 45 billion cny unk million usd
meteorological history
origins imbudo disorganized area convection near unk open western pacific mid july weak wind shear system slowly became better organized july 15 japan meteorological agency jma estimated tropical depression formed next day joint typhoon warning center jtwc issued tropical cyclone formation alert unk noting outflow increased due upper level low northeast 1800 utc july 16 jtwc initiated advisories tropical depression unk unk km 415 mi east yap subtropical ridge near okinawa steered nascent depression west northwest much duration warm waters favorable upper level conditions depression quickly organized jma upgraded tropical storm imbudo july 17
becoming tropical storm imbudo passed 35 km 20 mi north yap jma upgraded imbudo severe tropical storm late july 18 around time jtwc upgraded typhoon increase outflow south north tropical upper tropospheric trough unk caused 36 hour period rapid development beginning july 19 time jma upgraded imbudo typhoon status philippine unk unk astronomical services administration pagasa began issuing advisories storm approached philippines 30 km 20 mi wide eye formed 1200 utc july 20 jma estimated peak 10 minute sustained winds 165 km h 105 mph time jtwc estimated 1 minute sustained winds 240 km h 150 mph making super typhoon late july 20 typhoon developed concentric unk unk moving away thus diminishing outflow imbudo maintained peak winds 12 hours innermost eye contracted diameter 11 km 7 mi midst eyewall replacement cycle 0300 utc july 22 imbudo struck northern luzon 1 minute winds estimated 205 km h 125 mph jtwc
rapidly weakening land imbudo emerged south china sea six hours landfall jtwc estimated winds decreased 150 km h 90 mph although agency estimated imbudo quickly intensified secondary peak 165 km h 105 mph 1 minute winds dry air prevented convection unk significantly eye become large open waters 0300 utc july 24 imbudo made final landfall west unk near yangjiang guangdong strongest hit province since typhoon unk 1996 striking china 10 minute winds 140 km h 85 mph estimated jma storm rapidly weakened land moving southern china late july 25 imbudo dissipated near border china vietnam
preparations

hurricane felicia 2009
hurricane felicia third strongest tropical cyclone 2009 pacific hurricane season well strongest storm exist eastern pacific time since hurricane daniel 2006 forming tropical depression august 3 storm supported strong thunderstorm activity quickly organized became tropical storm following day subsequently underwent rapid deepening attain hurricane status later afternoon felicia featured well defined eye winds sharply rose major hurricane force saffir simpson scale strengthening ensued felicia peaked intensity category 4 hurricane sustained winds 145 mph 230 km h barometric pressure unk mbar hpa 27 61 inhg reaching strength unfavorable conditions wind shear began impact storm took northwestward path unk felicia slowly weakened several days august 8 downgraded category 1 hurricane becoming tropical storm next day unk westward towards hawaii august 10 decreasing organization august 11 felicia weakened tropical depression status soon degenerated remnant low prior passing islands

stay home dad
stay home dad alternatively stay home father house dad unk unk house spouse father main caregiver children homemaker household families evolved practice stay home dad become common socially acceptable
pre industrialisation family worked together unit self sufficient beginning industrial revolution large scale production replaced home manufacturing shift coupled prevailing norms governing sex gender roles dictated father become unk mother caregiver affection based marriages emerged 1830s parents began unk attention children family relationships became open beginning world war ii many women entered workforce necessity women resumed caregiver position war new found sense independence changed traditional family structure together cultural shifts leading feminist movement advances birth control women opted return care unk role others chose pursue careers women chose work outside home alternative childcare became necessity childcare options costly unavailable undesirable stay home dad became viable option
number stay home dads began gradually increasing late 20th century especially developed western nations recent statistic unk research released showed report june 2014 found 2 million men stay home dads however 2010 number stay home dads reached highest point 2 2 million
though role subject many stereotypes men may difficulties accessing parenting benefits communities services targeted mothers became socially acceptable 2000s stay home dad regularly portrayed media 2000s especially united states however due traditional family structures unk expectations stay home father figure culturally unacceptable countries east asia india
